Extreme Fear & Greed Index values predict near-term market reversals.
Correlation with sector peers changes significantly after major company-specific news.
Elevated VIX levels alongside a high put/call ratio signal increased risk aversion and potential market downside.
Increased volatility in the MACD oscillator suggests an impending directional move in price.
High correlation between sentiment and volatility predicts increased price swings.
Expression: Correlation = Correlation(Sentiment, Volatility); IF (Correlation > 0.7) THEN HighVolatility = 1 ELSE HighVolatility = 0

Description: A surge in positive sentiment accompanied by increased volume predicts a price breakout.
Expression: IF (Sentiment > 0.8 AND Volume > 2 * AvgVolume) THEN Breakout = 1 ELSE Breakout = 0

Description: Low-liquidity assets, after a period of underperformance, will generate excess returns compared to high-liquidity assets.
A sudden surge in trading volume coupled with positive sentiment will predict short-term price appreciation for illiquid assets.
High market liquidity, measured by average volume across major indices, signals increased market efficiency and reduced opportunities for alpha generation.
Assets with unusually wide bid-ask spreads will experience a narrowing of the spread, leading to price appreciation.
Undervalued stocks with low liquidity will outperform highly liquid undervalued stocks.
Assets with low correlation to the market and high liquidity will offer diversification benefits and outperform during market stress.
Assets with high liquidity and low volatility will outperform those with low liquidity and high volatility.
Stocks opening with a significant gap up are expected to experience a price correction in the next day.
Stocks with unexpectedly high earnings surprises in the last quarter show continued positive price performance.
Assets with strongly positive sentiment scores over the past week will outperform in the next week.
Expression: signal = Average(Sentiment_Score[i] for i in range(t-7,t))

Description: Assets outperforming their industry peers will continue to outperform.
Stocks trading at a significant discount to their book value will experience positive returns.
Stocks with historically low price volatility that experience a sudden increase in trading volume will outperform.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volatility_30day < 0.1 * avg(Volatility_industry) and Volume_today > 2 * Volume_avg_30day) else 0

Description: Companies with improving debt-to-equity ratios and undervalued metrics will outperform.
Companies with high free cash flow yield relative to their market capitalization will outperform.
Stocks with high volatility during periods of negative news sentiment will generate lower returns in the following week.
Decreased market correlation during high volatility predicts higher future returns.
A significant increase in trading volume accompanied by high volatility predicts lower returns over the next day.
The spread in volatility between high and low volatility sectors predicts future sector performance.
Assets experiencing a sustained period of low volume followed by a sudden surge will see a temporary price increase.
Expression: Signal = (V_t / AVG(V_{t-9:t})) * (STD(V_{t-9:t}) / V_t); where STD is standard deviation

Description: When volume increases but sentiment decreases, it indicates potential price weakness.
A decrease in correlation between an asset's price and its volume suggests a weakening of the liquidity trend.
Sudden price increases on unusually low volume suggest potential manipulation or unsustainable growth.
Expression: Signal = (Price(t) - Price(t-1)) / Volume(t) if Volume(t) < Avg(Volume(t-20:t-1)) else 0

Description: Large trades in illiquid assets, relative to order book depth, lead to significant price changes.
High P/E ratio coupled with decreasing volume suggests overvaluation and potential price correction.
A sudden increase in volume can signal a shift in market regime, potentially impacting future price direction.
Positive sentiment trending upward over 3 days predicts short-term price gains.
Market volatility decreases during the summer months (June-August).
Expression: Signal = Volatility(June-August) / Volatility(Year); if (Signal < 0.75) then Long

Group_Hypothesis: Seasonality: Asset prices exhibit predictable patterns based on the time of year.
Description: P/E ratios of certain sectors demonstrate predictable seasonal patterns.
Expression: Signal = (Average P/E Ratio for sector in Month X) - (Average P/E Ratio for sector across all months)

Description: High book-to-market stocks will underperform when the market-wide spread between book-to-market values shrinks.
Expression: Signal = (Current Book-to-Market Ratio) * (1 - (Current Market-wide Book-to-Market Ratio Spread / Previous Market-wide Book-to-Market Ratio Spread)); Short if Signal > Threshold

Description: Leveraging positions in high-yield assets will amplify returns (but also risks).
High-yield bonds that have recently outperformed their benchmark will continue to outperform in the short term.
Expression: Signal = (High-Yield Bond Return - Benchmark Return); Long if Signal > Threshold and positive momentum

Description: Emerging market currencies with high interest rate differentials relative to developed markets will appreciate.
High-yielding real estate investment trusts (REITs) will outperform in low inflation environments.
Expression: Signal = (Dividend Yield) / (Inflation Rate); Long REITs if Signal > Threshold and Inflation Rate < Threshold

Description: Commodities with high storage costs and positive contango will outperform in the long term.
Expression: Signal = (Contango) * (Storage Cost) ; Long Commodity if Signal > Threshold

Description: Selling covered call options on high-dividend stocks generates excess returns.
Expression: Signal = (Dividend Yield) + (Premium Received from Covered Call); Long Stock and Short Covered Call if Signal > Threshold

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: When the correlation between two assets decreases significantly, a mean reversion in price difference is expected.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: The spread between two correlated assets, when unusually wide, will narrow as arbitrageurs exploit the discrepancy.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: Significant deviation from the historical basis (price difference) between two assets is expected to revert.
Stock prices tend to exhibit abnormal returns on the day of an earnings announcement.
Extreme positive or negative sentiment leads to price mean reversion within 5 trading days.
Expression: Signal = z-score(Sentiment_t); Buy if Signal < -1 or Sell if Signal > 1;  Close positions in 5 days

Description: Stocks receiving overwhelmingly positive news experience a disproportionately large price jump.
Expression: Signal = (Positive_News_Score_t); Buy if Signal > threshold (e.g., 0.8) immediately

Description: Stocks receiving overwhelmingly negative news experience a larger price drop than predicted by baseline models.
Expression: Signal = (Negative_News_Score_t) * Beta; Sell if Signal > threshold (e.g., 0.7) immediately

Description: High positive sentiment combined with a low P/E ratio indicates a potential buying opportunity.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment_Score_t / P/E_ratio_t; if Signal > 2 then BUY

Description: Stocks with low sentiment and high P/E ratios underperform in the next 10 days.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment_t * P/E_t; Sell if Signal < threshold (e.g., 2) and hold for 10 days

Description: After a significant negative news event, stocks with a subsequent positive sentiment rebound outperform in the next week.
Expression: Signal = (Sentiment_{t} - Sentiment_{t-k}); Buy if signal > threshold (e.g., 0.2), where k represents the days since the event, and hold for 7 days

Description: A cascading effect of negative tweets on a given stock predicts a price drop within the next 24 hours.
Expression: IF (NegativeTweetCount(t) > 3*AverageNegativeTweetCount & NegativeTweetVelocity(t) > 0.5) THEN SellSignal = 1 ELSE SellSignal = 0

Description: The acceleration of social media sentiment predicts price momentum.
Unexpected positive analyst upgrades predict short-term price outperformance.
Expression: IF (AnalystUpgradeSurprise(t) > 1 & PriceChange(t-1) < 0) THEN BuySignal = 1 ELSE BuySignal = 0

Description: A divergence between the Fear & Greed Index and price movement suggests a reversal.
Expression: IF (FearGreedIndex(t) > 70 & Price(t) < Price(t-1)) THEN SellSignal = 1 ELSE SellSignal = 0

Description: Strong positive correlation between sentiment and volume indicates a stronger price move.
Expression: Correlation = CORR(SentimentScore[-30], Volume[-30]); IF (Correlation > 0.7) THEN Buy ELSE Hold

Description: High short interest combined with very positive sentiment is a bearish signal.
Expression: IF (ShortInterestRatio > 10 & SentimentScore > 0.9) THEN SellSignal = 1 ELSE SellSignal = 0

Description: Consecutive days with unusually high volume suggest a sustained price trend.
Expression: signal = sum(1 for v in Volume[t-5:t] if v > 2 * avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]))

Description: An unusual decrease in volume followed by a significant increase suggests a price reversal.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > 2 * avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) and Volume[t-1] < 0.5 * avg(Volume[t-20:t-1])) else 0

Description: Prolonged low volume after a significant price increase suggests potential exhaustion of buying pressure, predicting a price pullback.
Expression: Signal = (AVG(Volume[last 20 days]) < 0.7 * AVG(Volume[last 100 days])) AND (PriceChange[last 20 days] > 10%)

Description: A strong negative correlation between daily volume and price changes over the past week suggests a potential trend reversal.
High volume combined with positive sentiment indicates a stronger price increase.
The spread between two cointegrated stocks will revert to its long-term mean.
Expression: signal = (StockA - Beta * StockB) - SMA(StockA - Beta * StockB, 60)

Description: Similar companies within the same sector with diverging price movements will converge.
Stocks with high relative strength over the past three months will continue to outperform the market in the next month.
When an asset's relative strength converges with its price momentum, it signals future outperformance.
Expression: Signal = abs(RS - Momentum); where RS is Relative Strength and Momentum is a momentum indicator (e.g., RSI).

Description: Assets with high relative strength and low correlation to the market will provide higher returns.
Expression: Signal = RS / Correlation_market ; where RS is Relative Strength and Correlation_market is correlation to a market index.

Description: Assets with low relative strength volatility tend to outperform.
Stocks with accelerating year-over-year revenue growth will outperform stocks with decelerating revenue growth.
Stocks exceeding earnings-per-share expectations by a larger margin will generate higher returns than those that meet or underperform expectations.

Sub_Hypothesis: High P/E Ratio with Increasing EPS Growth
Description: Stocks with high P/E ratios but also showing accelerating EPS growth will outperform stocks with lower P/E ratios and slower EPS growth.
Expression: Signal = P/E Ratio * (Q2 EPS Growth - Q1 EPS Growth)

Description: Stocks experiencing a rapid increase in institutional ownership outperform those with declining ownership.
Expression: Signal = (Current Institutional Ownership - Previous Institutional Ownership) / Previous Institutional Ownership; Buy if Signal > 0.05

Sub_Hypothesis: Strong Revenue Growth and Low Volatility
Description: High revenue growth stocks with low price volatility will outperform high-growth, high-volatility stocks.
Expression: Signal = Revenue Growth / (Standard Deviation of Price over past year)

Sub_Hypothesis: Positive Correlation with Growth Sector Index
Description: Stocks exhibiting a high positive correlation with a growth sector index will outperform those with low or negative correlation.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(Stock Price, Growth Sector Index)

Sub_Hypothesis: High Growth and Low Price-to-Sales Ratio
Description: Stocks with high revenue growth and low price-to-sales ratios will outperform those with lower growth and higher P/S ratios.
Low volatility stocks with a high positive sentiment score outperform those with low sentiment scores.
Stocks with low realized volatility but high implied volatility often underperform.
Selling covered calls on low-volatility stocks generates excess returns by collecting premium.
The product of earnings surprise and trading volume predicts short-term price movement.
The correlation between pre-earnings sentiment and the magnitude of the surprise predicts short-term volatility.
The correlation between the sector's average earnings surprise and the individual stock's surprise predicts relative performance.
The deviation of the post-earnings P/E from its long-term average predicts a mean-reverting price movement.
A sharp increase in volume followed by a decrease in the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) suggests a potential price reversal.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 1.5 * Avg(Volume[t-30:t-1]) AND VWAP[t+1] < VWAP[t]) THEN Signal = -1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: High volume exceeding a specified threshold followed by a price crossing above its 20-day moving average suggests a price breakout.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > Threshold AND Price[t+1] > MA20[t+1]) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0

Sub_Hypothesis: Volume Spike and Negative Sentiment Divergence
Description: A large volume spike accompanied by a decrease in sentiment indicators predicts a short-term price decline.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 3 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Sentiment[t] < Sentiment[t-1]) THEN Signal = -1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: A large volume spike followed by a 5-day decay in volume often precedes a price reversal.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 2.5 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Avg(Volume[t+1:t+5]) < 0.7 * Volume[t]) THEN Signal = -1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: A significant volume increase combined with a shift in correlation with a benchmark index suggests a price change.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND ABS(Correlation[t] - Correlation[t-10]) > 0.1) THEN Signal = +/-1 (Based on correlation direction) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: A sudden increase in the volume-to-open ratio indicates higher-than-usual market activity.
Expression: IF ((Volume[t]/Open[t]) > 1.5 * Avg((Volume[t-20:t-1]/Open[t-20:t-1]))) THEN Signal = +/- 1 (Based on price movement after the spike) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: A large volume spike followed by two consecutive days of above-average volume suggests a sustained price movement.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 3 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Volume[t+1] > Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Volume[t+2] > Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1])) THEN Signal = +/-1 (Based on price direction) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: A significant volume spike followed by a sharp increase in short-term volatility predicts increased price fluctuations.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 2.5 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Volatility[t+1] > 1.2 * Avg(Volatility[t-20:t-1])) THEN Signal = +/- 1 (Based on price direction) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Stocks mentioned in positive technology news outperform the market.
Expression: Signal = IF(NewsCategory == 'Technology' AND SentimentPolarity > 0, 1, 0) //1 if positive tech news, 0 otherwise

Description: Stocks in sectors with overwhelmingly positive sentiment outperform those in sectors with negative sentiment.
Expression: Signal = AVG(SectorSentiment); //Average sentiment score across all stocks within a specific sector

Description: Smaller-cap stocks with an RSI below 30 are more likely to show a price rebound compared to larger-cap stocks.
Expression: Signal = RSI(ClosePrice, period=14) // If signal < 30, then buy

Description: A price breakout above the VWAP suggests sustained upward momentum.
A break above a strong resistance level signals a potential uptrend.
Expression: IF Price[t] > Resistance_Level AND Volume[t] > Avg_Volume THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Price increases confirmed by higher volume are stronger than those without.
Expression: IF (Price[t] > Price[t-1]) AND (Volume[t] > Volume[t-1]) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Companies that frequently exceed EPS expectations will outperform.
Companies with consistently improving operating cash flow will outperform.
Companies with CEOs who have served for a long period will outperform.
Companies where management owns a significant portion of the shares will outperform.
Stocks that experience a sharp drop after negative news will rebound within two trading days.
Expression: Signal = (Price[0] - Price[-1]) / Price[-1] if (Signal < -0.05) then 1 else 0

Description: A cluster of positive news events within a short time frame leads to higher short-term returns.
Expression: Signal = Count(PositiveNewsEvents, TimeWindow) ; Buy if Signal > Threshold

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Price discrepancies between cross-listed stocks on different exchanges will converge due to arbitrage opportunities.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Deviations in implied cross rates calculated from different currency pairs will converge to theoretical parity within a short time frame.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Put-call parity violations will present arbitrage opportunities based on the difference between calculated and market prices of options and underlying stock.
Expression: signal = MarketPrice - TheoreticalPrice (using Put-Call Parity Formula)

Description: Currencies with stronger recent performance, as measured by a weighted average of exchange rates, will offer superior carry returns.
Expression: Signal = (Carry_Currency * (SUM(ExchangeRate_t-i * w_i) / SUM(w_i))) where i represents a recent time window and w_i are weights.

Description: Unexpected changes in central bank policy statements will predict short-term carry trade deviations.
Higher carry trades will generate superior returns when adjusted for trading volume and bid-ask spreads.
A forecast of rising interest rates in the funding currency will decrease carry trade attractiveness.
Countries with lower debt-to-GDP ratios will exhibit better carry trade performance.
High P/E stocks with increasing momentum will outperform in bull markets.
Expression: Signal = (P/E_t - P/E_{t-1}) * Momentum_{t-1};  Momentum_{t-1} = (Price_t - Price_{t-n})/Price_{t-n} where n is lookback period

Description: Technology and consumer discretionary sectors outperform in bull markets.
Expression: Signal = Weight_Technology + Weight_ConsumerDiscretionary; Weights based on market cap

Description: Low volatility stocks outperform high volatility stocks in a strong bull market.
Expression: Signal = 1/Volatility; Volatility = Standard Deviation(Price_t) over n periods

Description: Positive media sentiment will have a stronger positive impact on stock returns during a bull market.
Stocks with increasing trading volume will outperform in a bull market.
Value stocks, characterized by low P/E ratios, are likely to outperform in a bear market.
Utilities and consumer staples outperform in bear markets.
Expression: Signal = Weight_Utilities + Weight_ConsumerStaples; Weights based on market cap

Description: The magnitude of the earnings surprise is inversely correlated with subsequent stock price volatility.
Expression: Signal = (EPS_Actual - EPS_Estimate) / Stock_Price_Volatility(Pre_Announcement); Higher Signal implies Lower Risk

Description: Positive revisions to future earnings guidance after a positive surprise amplify positive price drift.
Expression: Signal = (Revised_Guidance - Previous_Guidance) / Previous_Guidance * (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS

Description: The number of upward analyst revisions following a positive earnings surprise predicts subsequent price gains.
Expression: Signal = (Upward_Revisions_t) * (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS

Description: Higher overnight price changes in illiquid assets predict increased intraday volatility and potential short-term reversals.
A significant divergence between an illiquid asset's P/E ratio and its sector average suggests a potential price correction.
Positive news events following a period of low volume and negative price movement precede price appreciation.
Stocks experiencing a large negative guidance revision underperform significantly for the next quarter.
Expression: Signal = -1 * abs((Revised Guidance - Previous Guidance) / Previous Guidance)

Description: Stocks that experience a significant price jump immediately after the earnings announcement underperform in the long term (mean reversion).
Stocks with a higher positive correlation to the market in the week following earnings announcement underperform during market corrections.
Expression: Signal = -1 * Correlation(Stock Return, Market Return, window=5)

Description: Higher 30-day rolling volatility predicts higher future 30-day rolling volatility.
Negative news sentiment during high volatility predicts further high volatility.
Pairs with historically low correlation will exhibit a temporary positive correlation when their P/E ratios converge.
Expression: Signal = correlation(price_A, price_B, window=90) * (1 - abs(P/E_A - P/E_B) / (P/E_A + P/E_B)) #Positive correlation if P/E ratio convergence

Description: Significant news events impacting one asset more than another, despite historical high correlation, predict a short-term correlation decay.
Expression: signal = corr(AssetA_price[t-n:t], AssetB_price[t-n:t]) * News_Impact_Difference(AssetA, AssetB, t)

Description: A sudden spike in volatility of one asset in a highly correlated pair predicts a temporary negative correlation.
High positive correlation during trading hours reverses overnight due to external factors.
When the correlation between implied volatilities of two assets significantly differs from their price correlation, a price adjustment is predicted.
A decrease in liquidity of one asset in a highly correlated pair leads to a temporary weakening of the correlation.
Unexpected macroeconomic events temporarily disrupt correlations between assets.
Rising inflation leads to higher bond yields, negatively impacting stock prices.
Falling real interest rates (nominal rate minus inflation) predict higher equity valuations.
High inflation volatility increases uncertainty and reduces equity valuations.
A steepening yield curve (long-term minus short-term yields) predicts economic expansion and higher equity returns.
A high Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) predicts positive stock market returns.
A positive correlation between volume spikes and positive sentiment scores indicates potential upward momentum.
A significant volume gap followed by a price reversal indicates a potential change in market sentiment.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume_t > 1.5 * Avg(Volume_{t-20}) AND Price_t < Price_{t-1} AND Gap_t > 0.02*Price_{t-1}) else 0

Description: High volume coupled with a low P/E ratio indicates potential undervaluation and price appreciation.
Sustained high volume over several days indicates strong buying or selling pressure and predicts continued price movement.
Increased volume accompanied by a decrease in volatility predicts a significant price move.
Stocks experiencing a significant negative 10-day price momentum are predicted to outperform those with positive momentum over the following 3 days.
Stocks with an RSI below 30 will outperform those with an RSI above 70 over the next 2 days.
High short-term volatility is followed by lower volatility, predicting positive returns.
Stocks with the most negative news sentiment scores over the past 2 days will outperform those with the most positive sentiment over the next 1 day.
Expression: Signal = Rank(-AvgNewsSentiment_2Day); //Average news sentiment score over last 2 days

Description: Stocks that close below the lower Bollinger Band (20-day, 2 standard deviations) are expected to outperform stocks above the upper band in the next 2 days.
Stocks with low Price-to-Earnings ratios relative to their industry will outperform.
Stocks experiencing upward revisions in earnings estimates will outperform.
Stocks with high positive sentiment scores from news articles and social media will outperform those with negative sentiment.
Expression: Signal = SentimentScore; Buy stocks above a certain threshold (e.g., 0.7)

Description: Stocks with unusually high price volatility following earnings announcements will revert to lower volatility within 2 days.
Expression: Signal = 1/Average(Daily Volatility(t-2,t)); Buy if signal > threshold, else Hold

Description: Stocks with a significant price increase in the week leading up to earnings will underperform after the announcement.
Expression: Signal = (Price_PreEarnings - Price_WeekBefore) / Price_WeekBefore;  if Signal > 0.1 then Sell short else Hold

Description: Stocks with upward revisions to future earnings guidance will exhibit positive price momentum for 10 trading days.
Expression: Signal =  (Guidance_Revised - Guidance_Prior) / Guidance_Prior; Buy if Signal > 0.05 else Hold

Description: A significant compression of the P/E ratio in an illiquid asset, below its historical average, could signal a buying opportunity.
RSI values above 70 (overbought) or below 30 (oversold) indicate potential mean reversion.
Expression: signal = RSI; Buy if signal < 30, Sell if signal > 70

Description: High positive correlation between daily price changes over the last 5 days suggests continuation of the momentum in the next 2 days.
Stocks in the top 20% of the 30-day price performance will continue to outperform in the next 10 days.

Sub_Hypothesis: Book Value to Market Value Discrepancy
Description: Stocks trading significantly below their book value will generate excess returns.
Companies with a low P/S ratio relative to their peers and industry will outperform.
Undervalued stocks with historically high volatility that experience a decrease in volatility will outperform.
Stocks ranked in the lowest decile by volatility will outperform stocks in the highest decile over the next 6 months.
Expression: signal = 1 if volatility_rank < 0.1 else -1 if volatility_rank > 0.9 else 0

Description: Low-volatility stocks with high positive sentiment scores will outperform.
High correlation with the market index is a positive signal in a bull market.
Stocks with low volume-weighted volatility will outperform.
Expression: signal = -1 * sum(volume[i] * volatility[i] for i in range(window))/sum(volume[i] for i in range(window))

Description: Low volatility stocks with high dividend yields will outperform high volatility dividend-paying stocks.
Price increase with decreasing volume suggests weakening momentum and potential price drop.
Expression: Signal = -1 if Price[t] > Price[t-1] and Volume[t] < Volume[t-1] else 0

Description: Consistent high volume with sideways price action suggests accumulation before a price increase.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Avg(Volume[t-20:t]) > Avg(Volume[t-50:t-21]) and std(Price[t-20:t]) < 0.02 * Avg(Price[t-20:t]) else 0

Description: High volume relative to volatility suggests potential price movement.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Volume[t] / Volatility[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume/Volatility[t-100:t]) else 0

Description: The volume-weighted price change over a period predicts the direction of the next price move
Positive news sentiment about a sector outperforms the market's average sentiment, predicting sector outperformance.
Go long when sentiment is strongly positive and short when sentiment is strongly negative.
Positive earnings surprise amplified by positive sentiment predicts a stronger price reaction.
Increased selling pressure in December due to tax loss harvesting.
Returns show different patterns across the four financial quarters of the year.
Stocks tend to outperform in the final days of the month.
Expression: Signal = 1 if day is in the last 5 days of the month else 0

Description: Higher returns are observed in the last days of each quarter.
Market returns tend to be higher in the middle of the month.
The price will revert to its volume-weighted average price after a significant deviation.
Expression: vwap = sum(price * volume) / sum(volume); signal = (price - vwap) / vwap; if abs(signal) > 0.05 then long if signal < 0, short if signal > 0

Description: Large positive or negative 10-day rate of change in price is likely to revert.
Expression: signal = ((Price - Price[10]) / Price[10]) - SMA((Price - Price[10]) / Price[10], 20)

Description: Stocks with a significantly higher intrinsic value calculated via DCF than their market price will outperform.
Stocks with high book-to-market ratios will generate excess returns.
Elevated VIX levels predict subsequent market rallies.
Increasing volatility skew predicts positive future returns.
A widening spread between implied and realized volatility signals higher future returns.
High negative sentiment coupled with high volatility predicts lower future returns.
Decreasing correlation of asset volatility with market volatility suggests outperformance.
High option-implied volatility predicts lower future stock returns after a period of time.
A significant decrease in trading volume following a period of high volume predicts a short-term price reversal.
Increased volume accompanied by strong positive sentiment predicts sustained price increases.
When the correlation between an assets volume and its price breaks above a historical threshold, it predicts a sustained price movement.
Expression: signal = 1 if correlation(price_{t-30:t}, volume_{t-30:t}) > threshold else -1

Description: High volume following a significant price gap predicts continuation of the gap's direction.
Expression: signal = IF(Gap > 0 AND Volume > AVG(Volume, 20), 1, IF(Gap < 0 AND Volume > AVG(Volume, 20), -1, 0))

Description: A high P/E ratio combined with decreasing volume can indicate an impending price correction.
Expression: signal = -1 * P_E_Ratio * (Avg(Volume, 10) / Avg(Volume, 50)) if P_E_Ratio > 20 else 0

Description: A positive advance-decline ratio combined with high overall market volume is a bullish signal.
A sudden increase in news sentiment volatility predicts increased price volatility in the following three days.
Positive news sentiment despite a high P/E ratio indicates potential price correction.
Expression: signal = -1 if sentiment[-1] > 0 and PE[-1] > 2*avg(PE[-52:]) else 0

Description: When asset's sentiment diverges significantly from the market's sentiment, it predicts a price change.
Positive news sentiment for an asset exceeding sector average sentiment suggests outperformance.
Positive news sentiment confirms an upward price trend, increasing the likelihood of further gains.
Expression: signal = 1 if sentiment[-1] > 0 and price[-1] > price[-2] and price[-2] > price[-3] else 0

Description: Positive news sentiment following an earnings surprise predicts sustained price increases.
Expression: signal = 1 if sentiment[-1] > 0 and earnings_surprise[-1] > 0 else 0

Description: Stocks with high dividend yields that have recently underperformed will outperform.
High dividend yield stocks with low debt-to-equity ratios outperform.
High-yield assets that have experienced a short-term price decline will outperform in the near term.
High-yield assets with low correlation to the market will outperform.
High-yield assets with increasing trading volume will outperform.
The difference between the futures and spot prices of a highly correlated commodity will converge towards the cost of carry within the next trading day.
Profit from the temporary divergence between the price of an ETF and the value of its underlying assets.
Price discrepancies between an index and its constituent stocks create arbitrage opportunities that close within a few hours.
Expression: signal = index_price - sum(weight_i * price_i) for all i constituent stocks

Description: The price spread between two correlated assets will revert to its mean faster when trading volume is high.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: When the same asset trades at significantly different prices on two exchanges, an arbitrage opportunity exists until price convergence.
A significant news event causing a deviation from normal correlation between assets signals a profitable trade.
Stocks tend to perform better on certain days of the week (e.g., Monday)
Expression: Signal = Average(DailyReturn) for Mondays - Average(DailyReturn) for all other days

Description: Stocks tend to rebound after a significant holiday sell-off.
A large gap between market sentiment and individual stock sentiment will eventually close, resulting in price correction.
Price volatility increases after significant news events but decays exponentially thereafter, offering short-term trading opportunities.
The magnitude of price change following a news event is proportional to the difference between the predicted and actual news impact.
Positive sentiment leads to higher P/E multiples, creating a short-term buying opportunity before the reversion.
High correlation between sector sentiment and individual stock sentiment suggests future price movement in line with the sector.
A weighted average of sentiment and news impact scores provides a combined signal for price prediction.
Positive sentiment increases in the past three days predict a higher price on the fourth day.
Expression: IF (AVG(SentimentScore(t-3), SentimentScore(t-2), SentimentScore(t-1)) > 0.5) THEN PredictedPrice(t) = Price(t-1) * 1.01 ELSE PredictedPrice(t) = Price(t-1)

Description: Extreme positive sentiment is followed by a price decrease.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (MAX(Sentiment_{t-n:t}) - Sentiment_t) * Price_t where n is a lookback period (e.g., 5 days)

Description: Strong positive sentiment coupled with increasing trading volume predicts a price surge.
Expression: IF (SentimentScore > 0.8 AND VolumeChange > 0.15) THEN BuyStrength = SentimentScore * VolumeChange ELSE BuyStrength = 0

Description: Positive news events with high media coverage lead to a short-term price appreciation.
A sudden spike in positive social media mentions predicts an immediate price jump.
Expression: IF (SocialMediaMentionsChange > 10 * AVG(SocialMediaMentionsChange, 30)) THEN BuySignal = 1 ELSE BuySignal = 0

Description: High sentiment volatility indicates increased price uncertainty and potential for larger price swings.
Price movements lag behind sentiment changes by one day.
High sentiment combined with a low P/E ratio suggests undervalued stocks.
High correlation between sentiment and price change in the recent past predicts similar movements in the future.
A significant change in the trend of sentiment predicts a price movement in the same direction.
Expression: Signal = IF(Sentiment_trend_change = Positive, 1, IF(Sentiment_trend_change = Negative, -1, 0)) * Price_t

Description: A stock price is likely to reverse if volume increases significantly while the price stagnates or declines.
An unusual decrease in volume followed by a subsequent increase signals a price increase.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[today] < 0.5 * Avg(Volume[past 20 days]) AND Volume[yesterday] > Avg(Volume[past 20 days])) else 0

Description: High volume combined with high price correlation to a benchmark index predicts a price move.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) and corr(Price[t], IndexPrice[t], 20) > 0.8) else 0

Description: Low volume with low correlation to a benchmark implies potential independent price movement.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Volume[t] < 0.25 * avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) and corr(Price[t], IndexPrice[t], 20) < 0.2) else 0

Description: High volume in low P/E ratio stocks suggests potential undervaluation and price appreciation.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) and PE_Ratio[t] < industry_avg(PE_Ratio[t])) else 0

Description: Volume increasing over a short period (e.g., 5 days), followed by a decrease, signals a short-term price reversal.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > Volume[t-1] > Volume[t-2] > Volume[t-3] > Volume[t-4] and Volume[t] > Volume[t-5]) else 0

Description: A deviation from the cointegrating relationship between two stocks indicates a temporary mispricing.
High volatility in a stock's price over 20 days will revert to its historical average.
Stocks exhibiting strong recent momentum will experience a price reversal in the short term.
Sector performance relative to the market will deviate from its fair value based on news sentiment.
Overvalued sectors will underperform undervalued sectors in the short term.
Unexpected exposure to a specific factor will revert to the expected level.
Assets with converging relative strength and price momentum exhibit higher future returns.
Expression: momentum = (Asset_Price_Today / Asset_Price_10day_Avg) ; rs = (Asset_Price_20day_Avg / Benchmark_Price_20day_Avg) ; signal = momentum - rs

Sub_Hypothesis: PE Ratio and Relative Strength Disparity
Description: Assets with high relative strength but low P/E ratios relative to their peers are likely to outperform.

Sub_Hypothesis: Correlation with Market and Relative Strength
Description: Assets with low correlation to the market and high relative strength will outperform.
Expression: signal = Relative_Strength * (1 - CORR(Asset_Price, Market_Price, N)) where N is lookback period

Description: Positive earnings surprises combined with high relative strength predict strong future performance.
Expression: Signal = RS_5D * Earnings_Surprise; Earnings_Surprise: (Actual Earnings - Expected Earnings)

Sub_Hypothesis: High P/E Ratio with High Revenue Growth
Description: Companies with high Price-to-Earnings ratios but also high revenue growth will outperform those with similar P/E ratios but lower revenue growth.
Expression: Signal = Revenue Growth / P/E Ratio; Outperform if Signal > Threshold (e.g., 0.1)

Description: A positive shift in sentiment for low volatility stocks is associated with future outperformance.
Expression: Signal = (SentimentScore - Avg(SentimentScore, 30)) / StDev(SentimentScore, 30) if StDev(ClosePrice, 30) < Threshold else 0

Description: Low-beta smaller cap stocks that have underperformed recently will outperform.
A decline in the correlation between a low volatility stock and the market suggests an opportunity for outperformance.
Positive earnings surprises for low volatility stocks lead to higher future returns.
A simple binary classification (beat or miss) of earnings predicts short-term price direction.
Following a volume spike, the price will revert to its average price over the preceding period.
Expression: signal = avg(price[t-n:t-1]) - price[t], where n is the lookback period and t is current time

Description: A significant volume spike accompanied by a gap up or down indicates a strong directional movement.
Expression: Gap = Price[t] - Price[t-1]; IF (abs(Gap) > 0.05 * Price[t-1] AND Volume[t] > 3 * Avg(Volume[t-20, t-1])) THEN Signal = sign(Gap); Buy if Signal = 1; Sell if Signal = -1

Description: A volume spike coupled with a bearish RSI divergence suggests a potential price reversal and sell signal.
Expression: IF (Volume_today > avg(Volume, past_week) AND RSI_today < RSI_yesterday) THEN signal = -1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: Large volume spikes are followed by a surge in short-term price volatility.
A volume spike combined with a sudden negative change in market sentiment implies a bearish trend.
Expression: signal = -1 if volume[t] > avg(volume[t-n:t-1])*k & sentiment[t] < sentiment[t-1], where k is a multiplier

Sub_Hypothesis: Volume Spike and P/E Ratio Change
Description: A significant volume spike coupled with a P/E ratio drop suggests undervaluation.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-20, t-1]) AND PE_Ratio[t] < PE_Ratio[t-1]) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0; Buy if Signal = 1

Description: A significant increase in 5-day average volume followed by a decrease predicts a price reversion to the mean.
Assets that experience a sharp price drop after negative news frequently rebound in the short term.
Expression: Signal = -Price Change(t) * Volume(t);  Positive Signal implies Buy

Description: High P/E ratio combined with high positive sentiment suggests an overvalued asset, leading to potential underperformance.
High correlation between asset sentiment and market sentiment predicts similar price movements.
Expression: signal = corr(asset_sentiment[t-30:t], market_sentiment[t-30:t]); //Higher correlation suggests similar movement

Description: A breakout above the upper trendline of an ascending triangle pattern signals a price increase.
A bullish crossover of the MACD histogram suggests an upward trend.
Expression: Signal = 1 if MACDHistogram[t] > 0 AND MACDHistogram[t-1] < 0 else 0

Description: Companies with consistently high return on invested capital (ROIC) will outperform.
Companies with ROIC consistently exceeding their cost of capital will outperform.
Companies with high average analyst ratings will outperform.
Companies experiencing a consistent increase in institutional ownership will outperform.
Stocks that exceed EPS expectations will see sustained upward momentum for one week.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS; Buy if Signal > 0.05 and hold for 1 week

Description: Price volatility decreases exponentially after significant news events.
After a negative earnings surprise, stocks with lower P/E ratios rebound faster than higher ones.
Expression: Signal = P/E Ratio; Buy if (P/E < threshold AND Earnings Surprise < 0)

Description: High volume in a declining stock that shows sudden price increase suggests short covering.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Volume_t > 2 * Average(Volume_{t-20:t-1}) and Price_t > Price_{t-1} and Price_{t-1} < Price_{t-5}

Description: Following significantly negative news, the price will often overshoot downwards before recovering.
Expression: Signal = (Negative News Score * Price Change); if Signal < -Threshold then BUY (long-term) else HOLD

Description: A deviation of a single stock's price from its expected contribution to an index it's part of implies a mispricing.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The difference between futures and spot prices will converge towards the cost of carry.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Spreads between yields of bonds with differing maturities will revert to historical averages.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: A weighted basket of assets will maintain a relatively stable value against a benchmark, providing arbitrage when deviations occur.

Sub_Hypothesis: Short-Term Reversion to Interest Rate Differential
Description: The daily return of a carry trade will partially revert to the interest rate differential within 5 days.
Carry trades will perform better when sentiment towards the funding currency is negative.
A negative forward premium (high-yield currency is expected to depreciate) predicts a positive return in the carry trade.
Carry trades will perform better when the yield curve of the high-yield currency is steep.
Technology stocks will outperform the market in bull markets.
Small-cap stocks tend to outperform large-cap stocks during bull markets.
The magnitude of the earnings surprise positively correlates with short-term price momentum.
Stocks with negative earnings surprises show a temporary P/E ratio increase followed by a sharper decline.
Expression: Signal = (P<sub>t</sub>/E<sub>t</sub>) / (P<sub>t-1</sub>/E<sub>t-1</sub>) where a signal above 1.1 within 2 days of earnings release is flagged for shorting.

Description: The change in news sentiment scores correlates with the magnitude of post-earnings announcement drift.
Expression: Signal = (Sentiment<sub>post</sub> - Sentiment<sub>pre</sub>) * (P<sub>t+5</sub> - P<sub>t</sub>) / P<sub>t</sub> where sentiment is a score from news analysis.

Description: The number of upward analyst revisions before earnings announcement predicts the magnitude of positive post-announcement drift.
The rate at which the initial price reaction to an earnings surprise decays over time can be used to predict future price movements.
Expression: Signal =  (P<sub>t+1</sub> - P<sub>t</sub>)/(P<sub>t</sub>-P<sub>t-1</sub>) ;  a faster decay rate after a large surprise suggests future reversal.

Description: Positive earnings surprises lead to gradual, sustained increases in the P/E ratio over a longer term (e.g., 3 months).
Expression: Signal = (P<sub>t+60</sub>/E<sub>t+60</sub>) / (P<sub>t</sub>/E<sub>t</sub>) - 1 where t+60 is 60 days after announcement.  A positive signal shows an increase.

Description: The impact of earnings surprises on stock prices is greater during periods of low market volatility.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS * (1 / VIX<sub>t</sub>) where VIX<sub>t</sub> is the volatility index at time t.

Description: A price breakout on unusually low volume in an illiquid stock can signal a false breakout and subsequent reversal.
Divergence between the illiquid asset and a highly correlated liquid peer may present short-term arbitrage opportunities.
A large deviation in the P/E ratios of two correlated companies suggests a temporary mispricing opportunity.
A sudden widening of the bid-ask spread can predict increased price volatility and potential for short-term profit.
Stocks that beat EPS expectations by a large margin will experience a price reversion within 5 days.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (EPS_Actual - EPS_Estimate) / EPS_Estimate if (EPS_Actual > EPS_Estimate) and (abs(EPS_Actual - EPS_Estimate)/EPS_Estimate > 0.1) else 0

Description: Stocks that miss revenue expectations will exhibit negative momentum for the next 2 trading days.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (Revenue_Actual - Revenue_Estimate) / Revenue_Estimate if (Revenue_Actual < Revenue_Estimate) else 0

Description: The strength of the post-earnings announcement drift is positively correlated with the magnitude of the earnings surprise.
Higher trading volume following an earnings announcement amplifies the PEAD effect.
Stocks with overwhelmingly positive post-earnings sentiment will experience a slight price correction within 3 days.
Stocks with extremely negative post-earnings sentiment will continue to decline for at least one day.
Stocks with significantly upgraded guidance will outperform the market in the following week.
Stocks with significantly downgraded guidance will underperform the market in the following week.
A significant expansion in the P/E ratio after an earnings beat will lead to a price pullback within 10 days.
Stocks within a sector that exhibit a high correlation post-earnings announcement will move in a similar direction.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(Stock_A_Return, Sector_Average_Return) * Stock_A_Return if (Correlation(Stock_A_Return, Sector_Average_Return) > 0.8) else 0

Description: Buy when short-term moving average volatility exceeds long-term moving average volatility, and sell when the opposite occurs.
Expression: signal = 1 if volatility_SMA_short > volatility_SMA_long else -1 if volatility_SMA_short < volatility_SMA_long else 0

Description: Buy when Bollinger Band width contracts, indicating low volatility, and sell when it expands, indicating high volatility.
Expression: signal = 1 if (upper_band - lower_band) < threshold_low else -1 if (upper_band - lower_band) > threshold_high else 0

Description: Buy assets with lower recent volatility rank percentile compared to historical volatility rank percentile and short assets with the reverse.
Expression: signal = 1 if current_volatility_rank_percentile < historical_volatility_rank_percentile_threshold else -1 if current_volatility_rank_percentile > historical_volatility_rank_percentile_threshold else 0

Description: Go long when the VIX futures term structure is in contango (longer-dated futures are more expensive) and short when it is in backwardation.
Expression: signal = 1 if vix_future_long > vix_future_short else -1 if vix_future_long < vix_future_short else 0

Description: High realized volatility (sum of squared intraday returns) predicts higher future realized volatility.
High correlation between asset volatilities predicts continued high correlation and volatility.
Disparate changes in P/E ratios of highly correlated stocks predict a weakening of their correlation.
Expression: signal = -1 * abs( (pe_a[t] - pe_a[t-1])/pe_a[t-1] - (pe_b[t] - pe_b[t-1])/pe_b[t-1] ) * corr(price_a[t-30:t], price_b[t-30:t])

Description: A sudden increase in the volatility of one asset, while its correlation with another remains low, predicts a price movement in the less volatile asset.
Pairs with historically high correlation will show a temporary shift in correlation following significant macroeconomic announcements.
Expression: Signal = correlation(price_A, price_B, window=100) - post_announcement_correlation(price_A, price_B, window=5)

Description: Correlation between assets weakens overnight; this temporary deviation can be exploited by identifying pairs with abnormally high overnight correlation.
High-frequency trading strategies can profit from the transient breakdown of correlations detectable only at very high frequencies.
Changes in the influence of a common factor on correlated assets cause temporary correlation shifts that generate trading signals.

Group_Hypothesis: Broad Macroeconomic Trends and Indicators Influence Asset Prices
Description: Strong GDP growth momentum leads to higher returns in cyclical sectors.

Group_Hypothesis: Broad Macroeconomic Trends and Indicators Influence Asset Prices
Description: Decreases in the unemployment rate predict higher consumer spending and stock prices.

Group_Hypothesis: Broad Macroeconomic Trends and Indicators Influence Asset Prices
Description: A weakening domestic currency positively impacts export-oriented companies' stock prices.

Group_Hypothesis: Broad Macroeconomic Trends and Indicators Influence Asset Prices
Description: Significant increases in commodity prices negatively affect consumer discretionary stocks.

Group_Hypothesis: Broad Macroeconomic Trends and Indicators Influence Asset Prices
Description: High VIX values indicate increased market uncertainty, potentially leading to lower returns.

Group_Hypothesis: Broad Macroeconomic Trends and Indicators Influence Asset Prices
Description: A strong Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) suggests positive business sentiment and stock market gains.
A sudden increase in the volume/price ratio suggests an impending price change.
A volume spike accompanied by negative sentiment suggests a short-term buying opportunity.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 3 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Sentiment[t] < 0) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0; Buy if Signal = 1

Description: Increased volume with a change in correlation to a benchmark index suggests a directional movement.
Confirmation of a price trend by a high-volume increase implies continuation.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Close[t]>Close[t-1] and Volume[t]>Volume[t-1] and Volume[t] > 1.5*Avg(Volume[t-20:t])) or (Close[t]<Close[t-1] and Volume[t]>Volume[t-1] and Volume[t] > 1.5*Avg(Volume[t-20:t])) else 0

Description: A significant change in P/E ratio alongside unusual volume suggests a potential market revaluation.
An increasing volume trend over a short period (e.g., 3 days) preceding a significant spike predicts price movement.
Expression: signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > 2*Volume[t-1] and Volume[t-1] > 1.5*Volume[t-2] and Volume[t] > 2*Avg(Volume[t-20:t])) else 0

Description: Stocks with the most negative recent news sentiment scores are projected to outperform those with positive sentiment scores in the subsequent trading session.
Stocks showing an overbought condition (e.g., RSI > 70) are expected to underperform in the next 2 days.
Rapidly growing small-cap stocks maintain momentum and outperform.
Expression: Signal = (RevenueGrowth[t] - RevenueGrowth[t-4]) * (Price[t] - Price[t-4])/Price[t-4]; Buy if Signal > 0.1 and MarketCap < $500M

Description: Stocks with larger positive earnings surprises outperform those with smaller surprises in the following week.
Stocks with positive earnings surprises and low pre-earnings announcement volatility outperform.
Stocks exhibiting a significant price increase in the week before the announcement will underperform in the week after.
Stocks that experience a large positive price jump immediately following the announcement will continue to outperform in the next few days.
The impact of an earnings surprise is amplified by trading volume around the announcement.
Stocks with a positive sentiment shift but a negative earnings surprise underperform.
Stocks with large price increases on the day of the announcement will experience a price reversion the following day.
Stocks with upward revisions in EPS estimates prior to the announcement will outperform those with downward revisions.
Stocks that show a significant negative correlation with the market in the days leading to the announcement outperform after a positive earnings surprise.
The effect of an earnings surprise is magnified for stocks with low P/E ratios.
A positive 20-day price momentum indicates sustained upward pressure.
Stocks with high correlation to their industry's performance tend to follow the industry trend.
Assets that have the highest 5-day price returns will continue to outperform in the next 2 days.
Assets with accelerating growth in their P/E ratio over the last month will continue to outperform.
Stocks with consistently high price volatility over the last week will have strong short-term momentum.
Assets that open with a significant gap up will continue to outperform over the next day.
Stocks with a low Price-to-Book ratio relative to their industry will generate higher returns.
High dividend yield stocks with low P/E ratios will outperform the market.
Low P/E ratios combined with positive earnings growth signal outperformance.
Undervalued cyclical stocks will outperform during economic recoveries.
Value stocks with positive recent price momentum will outperform value stocks without.
Assets with valuations significantly below their peers within a specific sector will outperform.
Low P/E stocks with low debt-to-equity ratios will outperform.
Undervalued stocks with positive or improving analyst sentiment will outperform.
A sudden change in the positive correlation between volume and price suggests a potential trend reversal.
Expression: Signal = -1 * Correlation(Volume_{t-20:t-1}, Price_{t-20:t-1}) if Correlation(Volume_{t-5:t}, Price_{t-5:t}) < 0 else 0

Sub_Hypothesis: Gap and Go with High Volume
Description: A significant price gap up followed by high volume confirms a potential continuation of the uptrend.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Gap_t > 0.02 * Price_{t-1} and Volume_t > 2 * Average(Volume_{t-20:t-1}) else 0

Description: A high P/E ratio combined with unusually high volume may indicate an overvalued asset.
Expression: Signal = -1 if P/E_t > 2 * Average(P/E_{t-20:t-1}) and Volume_t > 3 * Average(Volume_{t-20:t-1}) else 0

Description: High positive sentiment combined with high volume predicts stronger price increases.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: The tracking error of an ETF relative to its benchmark index will revert to the mean.
Low volatility in the spread between correlated futures contracts presents a higher-probability mean reversion trade.
Differences in interest rate between two countries correlated with ETF price movements.
Expression: Signal = Interest_Rate(Country1) - Interest_Rate(Country2); Action: Long ETF of the country with higher interest rate/short ETF of the country with lower interest rate if Signal > Threshold, Vice-versa if Signal < -Threshold

Description: Significant deviations from the expected conversion premium of a convertible bond signal a mispricing.
Low volatility in a basket of correlated assets presents a higher-probability mean reversion trade.
Using PCA to identify and exploit co-movements in a portfolio of assets.
A stochastic oscillator crossing above 20 predicts a price increase.
Expression: IF (Stochastic Oscillator crosses above 20) THEN Buy Signal

Description: High ATR values suggest increased volatility and potential for larger price swings.
A short-term moving average crossing below a long-term moving average indicates a potential mean reversion upward.
Expression: signal = 1 if SMA(Price, 5) < SMA(Price, 20) and SMA(Price, 5) crosses below SMA(Price,20) else 0

Description: A decrease in short interest coupled with positive price movement suggests sustained momentum.
Stocks that experience high price volatility and still show positive momentum are likely to continue the trend.
Stocks with a CAPE ratio significantly below the market average will outperform.
Stocks with a P/B ratio significantly below their industry average will generate excess returns.
High volatility combined with high volume predicts lower future returns.
Decreasing correlations with a market index during increased volatility predict underperformance.
High P/E ratios combined with increasing volatility predict negative returns.
A significant volume spike followed by a sharp volume dip predicts a short-term price decrease.
Expression: signal = (V_t - V_{t-1}) * (V_{t-1} - V_{t-2}); if signal > threshold then short

Description: Assets trading with low volume but high volatility are likely to experience a significant price swing.
Expression: signal = volatility(P_{t-n:t}) / mean(V_{t-n:t}); if signal > threshold then long/short based on trend

Description: A sudden increase in volume coupled with a high P/E ratio predicts a price correction.
Expression: signal = (V_t - V_{t-1}) / V_{t-1} * P/E_t; if signal > threshold then short

Description: Decreasing bid-ask spread and decreasing volume signals drying up of liquidity and potential for price volatility.
Expression: signal = (bid-ask spread_t - bid-ask spread_{t-1}) + (V_t - V_{t-1}); if signal < threshold then avoid trading

Sub_Hypothesis: Sudden Volume Increase and Correlation Shift
Description: A sudden increase in volume coupled with a shift in correlation with a benchmark index indicates an event-driven price movement.
Expression: signal = (V_t - V_{t-1}) * (correlation(P_t, Index_t) - correlation(P_{t-1},Index_{t-1})); if |signal| > threshold then trade based on the direction of correlation shift

Description: A significant difference between the closing volume and the opening volume of the following day predicts short-term price movement.
Expression: signal = V_t (opening) - V_{t-1} (closing); if |signal| > threshold then long/short based on the direction of the signal

Description: High sentiment volatility predicts higher price volatility.
High social media mentions with predominantly positive sentiment predicts short-term price gains.
The average sentiment over the past three days predicts price movement on the following day.
The strength of positive or negative sentiment in news articles predicts the magnitude of price change.
A weighted average of news and social media sentiment scores predicts price movement.
High-yield bonds with low duration (less sensitive to interest rate changes) tend to outperform when rates are volatile.
Expression: Signal = (Yield to Maturity) / (Modified Duration) * (Interest Rate Volatility)

Description: Certain sectors outperform during specific times of the year.
Expression: Signal = (Sector Return - Market Return) for each season

Description: A significant increase in news volume predicts increased price volatility in the subsequent 24 hours.
A strong positive correlation between daily news sentiment and lagged price changes indicates future price increases.
Expression: Signal = CORR(SentimentScore, Price_lag1, 20); if (Signal > Threshold) then Buy; else Sell;

Description: Positive earnings news leads to increased returns within one week.
Positive news sentiment combined with high trading volume amplifies price gains.
A composite index of news sentiment and market sentiment predicts future price movements.
High positive sentiment coupled with high volume predicts price increases.
Positive news tone increases price proportionally to its magnitude.
A correlation between past sentiment and future price changes predicts future movements.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(Sentiment_{t-n:t-1}, Price_{t:t+m}) where n and m are lookback and forward periods

Description: Price divergence from sentiment suggests a potential reversal.
High sentiment amplifies price volatility in the following period.
A sharp increase in the volume/price ratio indicates a potential price reversal.
Decreasing volume preceding a significant price increase suggests a potential breakout.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] < 0.5 * Avg(Volume[t-10:t-1]) and Price[t+1] > Price[t] + 0.03 * Price[t]) else 0

Description: A sudden increase in the positive correlation between volume and price predicts a price increase.
Price increasing while volume decreases (negative correlation divergence) is a bearish signal.
Expression: signal = -1 if (Price[t] > Price[t-1] and Volume[t] < Volume[t-1]) else 0

Description: High trading volume coupled with negative market sentiment predicts a potential short-term price drop.
Expression: Signal = -1 if (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Sentiment[t] < -0.5) else 0

Description: High volume accompanied by a high P/E ratio suggests an overvalued asset and potential correction.
Expression: signal = -1 if (Volume[t] > 1.5 * avg(Volume[t-30:t-1]) and PE[t] > 2 * avg(PE[t-30:t-1])) else 0

Description: Increased volume confirms a strong relative strength signal, predicting continued outperformance.
Expression: signal = 1 if (RS[t] > 1.2 and Volume[t] > avg(Volume[t-20:t-1])) else 0

Description: When the spread between two cointegrated stocks deviates significantly from its historical average, it will revert.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: The spread between two correlated assets exhibits positive momentum; this momentum is expected to continue for a short period.
Stocks with RSI crossing below 30 are undervalued and will outperform.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: Different market reactions to the same news event for correlated assets create short-term arbitrage opportunities.
Large volume changes without significant price changes predict a future price reversal.
An ARIMA model forecasts future price movements based on past price data.
When an asset's relative strength diverges significantly from its sector's relative strength, a correction is likely.
Positive sentiment combined with high relative strength predicts above-average returns.
Assets with low correlation to the benchmark and high relative strength offer higher potential returns.
A short-term relative strength moving average crossing above a long-term moving average indicates a bullish signal.
Expression: signal = 1 if SMA(relative_strength, short_period) > SMA(relative_strength, long_period) else 0

Description: Stocks that exceed earnings expectations by a significant margin will outperform those that miss or barely meet expectations.

Sub_Hypothesis: High PE Ratio with Growth Justification
Description: Stocks with high P/E ratios but strong projected future earnings growth will outperform stocks with low P/E ratios and low growth.
Stocks with a high positive correlation between revenue growth and earnings growth will outperform those with a low or negative correlation.
