Expression: signal = (sum(Basis * Volume, 20) / sum(Volume, 20) - avg(sum(Basis * Volume, 20) / sum(Volume, 20), 20)) / stddev(sum(Basis * Volume, 20) / sum(Volume, 20), 20)

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: ETF vs. Underlying Holdings
Description: The discount of an ETF relative to the net asset value (NAV) of its underlying holdings will revert to its 1-year average within 3 days.
Expression: signal = ( (ETF_Price / NAV) - avg((ETF_Price / NAV), 252) ) / stddev((ETF_Price / NAV), 252)

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Bond Futures vs. Underlying Bonds
Description: The difference between the implied yield of a bond future and the yield of its most similar deliverable bond will converge within 2 days.
Deviations from the expected carry trade return (interest rate differential) in a currency pair will be corrected within 1 week.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Commodity Futures vs. Spot Prices
Description: The contango or backwardation in a commodity futures market will adjust towards its historical average within 1 month.
Expression: signal = (Futures_Price - Spot_Price - avg(Futures_Price - Spot_Price, 21)) / stddev(Futures_Price - Spot_Price, 21)

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Convertible Bonds vs. Underlying Equity
Description: The premium of a convertible bond over its conversion value will revert to its 60-day average within 10 days.
Expression: signal = (Convertible_Bond_Price - Conversion_Value - avg(Convertible_Bond_Price - Conversion_Value, 60)) / stddev(Convertible_Bond_Price - Conversion_Value, 60)

Description: The implied volatility difference between a straddle and strangle on the same underlying will revert to its 30-day average.
Expression: signal = (Straddle_Implied_Volatility - Strangle_Implied_Volatility - avg(Straddle_Implied_Volatility - Strangle_Implied_Volatility, 30)) / stddev(Straddle_Implied_Volatility - Strangle_Implied_Volatility, 30)

Description: The relative performance of two sector ETFs with historically high correlation will revert to the mean of their 6-month rolling correlation.
Market returns are lower during the summer months.
Expression: Signal = Average Return during June, July, and August

Description: A high correlation between daily news volume and price changes predicts continued price movement in the same direction.
Expression: correlation = correlation(news_volume, price_change, 20); if (correlation > 0.7) then buy; else if (correlation < -0.7) then sell; else hold;

Description: A sudden spike in both positive news sentiment and trading volume predicts a short-term price increase.
Expression: signal = sentiment_score * volume; if (signal > threshold) then buy; else hold;

Description: Increased volume of negative financial news correlates with higher short-term price volatility.
Expression: volatility = stddev(price_change, 10); signal = volume_financial_news; if (signal > threshold && volatility > avg_volatility) then sell; else hold;

Description: The impact of news events is amplified by prevailing market sentiment.
Expression: signal = news_impact * sentiment_score; if (signal > threshold) then buy; else sell;

Description: The strength of an upward or downward trend in sentiment predicts the direction of price movement.
Expression: Signal = Slope(LinearRegression(Sentiment<sub>t-n</sub>)) where n is the lookback period.

Description: A delay in the price reaction to positive social media sentiment indicates a potential buying opportunity.
Stocks with high positive sentiment that show low correlation with their sector outperform.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment - Correlation(StockPrice, SectorIndex, 30); //Higher values are more positive

Description: High trading volume coupled with unusually low price volatility anticipates price momentum in the following 5 days.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Volatility[t] < Avg(Volatility[t-20:t-1])) else 0

Description: Sustained low volume after a significant price increase signals potential price correction.
Expression: Signal = -1 if (Avg(Volume[t-10:t]) < 0.7 * Avg(Volume[t-30:t-10]) AND Price[t] > Price[t-10]) else 0

Description: A sudden increase in the positive correlation between volume and price predicts a continuation of the price trend in the next 2 days.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Corr(Volume[t-10:t], Price[t-10:t]) > 0.8 AND Corr(Volume[t-10:t], Price[t-10:t]) > Corr(Volume[t-20:t-10], Price[t-20:t-10])) else 0

Description: A significant increase in the ratio of volume to P/E suggests a potential price increase.
Companies with P/E ratios significantly deviating from their historical average will see their P/E ratios revert towards the mean.
Positive sentiment scores predict short-term price increases, while negative sentiment scores predict price decreases.
When the correlation between two historically highly correlated assets weakens, a temporary mispricing is expected.
Positive earnings surprises are associated with increased short-term price appreciation.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Tracking error between an ETF and its underlying index will mean revert within a defined timeframe.
Expression: Signal = (ETFReturn - IndexReturn) / IndexReturn; Buy ETF if Signal < -Threshold, Sell ETF if Signal > Threshold

Description: The aggregated sentiment from news articles about a company predicts short-term price movements.
Assets at the lowest percentile of relative strength tend to exhibit a mean reversion in the following week.
Assets with high relative strength and low sector P/E ratios tend to outperform.
A change in the short-term trend of relative strength signals potential for a directional price movement.
A significant increase in the RS rank percentile suggests potential for future outperformance.
Companies with high return on equity (ROE) and high revenue growth will outperform.
Expression: Signal = ROE * RevenueGrowthRate; Rank stocks by Signal, buy top decile

Description: Stocks exhibiting significantly higher sales growth than their competitors will outperform.
Expression: Signal = (CompanySalesGrowth - AverageCompetitorSalesGrowth) / AverageCompetitorSalesGrowth; if Signal > 0.2 then Buy; else Sell;

Description: High-growth companies with low levels of debt relative to equity outperform high-growth companies with high debt.
Expression: Signal = Revenue Growth / Debt-to-Equity Ratio; Buy if Signal > 10

Description: Stocks receiving a significant number of analyst upgrades will outperform.
Expression: Signal = NumberOfUpgrades - NumberOfDowngrades; if Signal > 2 then Buy; else Sell;

Description: Stocks with a low P/E ratio relative to their historical volatility will outperform.
Expression: Calculate (P/E) / (Annualized Volatility); long stocks with the lowest values.

Description: Low volatility stocks that decline in price will show a higher probability of mean reversion.
Expression: Identify low volatility stocks that are down X% in the last Y days; buy to open on the subsequent day.

Description: Stocks with a low negative correlation to the VIX index will outperform.
Expression: Calculate the correlation between each stock's returns and the VIX over the past year; long stocks with the lowest negative correlation.

Description: Low-volatility stocks with unusually high trading volume will generate above-average returns.
Expression: Rank stocks by volatility; identify stocks in lowest quartile and above average volume (relative to past 30 days); long these stocks.

Description: The magnitude of the price reaction to an earnings surprise is amplified by trading volume.
Positive earnings surprises lead to sustained positive price momentum over the following two weeks.
Stocks that exhibit lower correlation to sector movement post-earnings have higher independent alpha.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(Stock Return, Sector Return, post-earnings 5 days); Buy if Signal < 0.5

Description: The magnitude of the earnings surprise is inversely related to future price volatility.
Stocks that beat expectations outperform those that meet or miss expectations.
A 3-day average volume exceeding 2 standard deviations above the 20-day average volume predicts a price increase within the next 5 days.
Expression: IF AVG(Volume[t-2:t]) > AVG(Volume[t-19:t]) + 2*STDDEV(Volume[t-19:t]) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: A significant increase in the volume/price ratio above its 20-day moving average signals an impending price correction.
Following a volume spike exceeding 3 standard deviations above the 50-day average, a price reversion to the 20-day moving average is expected within 5 days.
Expression: IF Volume[t] > AVG(Volume[t-49:t]) + 3*STDDEV(Volume[t-49:t]) THEN signal = Price[t-5] - MA(Price, 20)[t-5]

Description: A divergence between price and VWAP after a volume spike suggests a potential price reversal.
A volume spike followed by sustained above-average volume for the next 2 days suggests a continuation of the price trend.
Expression: IF Volume[t] > 2 * AVG(Volume[t-19:t]) AND Volume[t+1] > AVG(Volume[t-19:t]) AND Volume[t+2] > AVG(Volume[t-19:t]) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: A positive sentiment change after a large volume spike predicts a further price increase.
A sudden drop in correlation between price and volume after a large volume spike suggests a change in market dynamics.
A significant price gap upward following a large volume spike suggests a continuation of the uptrend.
Expression: IF (Price[t] > Price[t-1]) AND (Volume[t] > 3 * AVG(Volume[t-19:t])) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: High growth expectations combined with positive sentiment generate higher returns.
A break above the upper trendline of a flag pattern confirms the preceding trend.
Expression: Identify Flag pattern; IF (Price[t] > UpperTrendline AND Volume[t] > AVG(Volume[t-10:t])) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Breakouts from symmetrical triangles are generally high-probability signals.
Expression: Identify Symmetrical Triangle pattern; IF (Price[t] > UpperTrendline OR Price[t] < LowerTrendline) THEN Signal = sign(Price[t]-Average(Price[t-10:t])) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Three consecutive bullish candlesticks with increasing highs and closing near highs indicate strong bullish momentum.
Expression: Identify Three White Soldiers pattern; IF (pattern detected) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Increasing volume during an uptrend and decreasing volume during a downtrend confirms the trend's strength.
Expression: Signal = TrendStrength(Price) * (Volume(t) / AvgVolume(30))  (TrendStrength = 1 for uptrend, -1 for downtrend)

Description: Companies with consistently increasing free cash flow over the past three years will outperform.
The impact of news events on asset prices diminishes over time, following an exponential decay model.
Expression: Signal = (Post-news Price Change) * exp(-time_since_news/decay_constant); decay_constant is a parameter to be optimized.

Description: Stocks that show less correlation to sector movement following news are undervalued.
Expression: Signal = 1 - Correlation(Stock Price Change, Sector Price Change) in the period after news; Buy if Signal > 0.8

Description: Negative news followed by rapid improvement in short-term sentiment suggests a buying opportunity.
Expression: Signal = (Post-news Sentiment Score - Pre-news Sentiment Score) / Time since News; Buy if Signal > 0.05 and Pre-news Sentiment <0

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Large spreads between yields of similar maturity bonds will narrow as arbitrageurs exploit the discrepancy.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: An ETF tracking a specific index will maintain a close price correlation with the index; deviations represent potential arbitrage.
Unexpected interest rate changes predict short-term currency movements against the carry trade.
Decreased global risk appetite negatively impacts carry trade returns.
A decrease in the correlation between the two currencies signals reduced carry trade risk.
Positive FX sentiment for the high-yield currency enhances carry trade profitability.
Undervalued stocks (low P/E ratio) will outperform in a bull market, reverting to their mean.
Expression: Signal = 1 - (Stock P/E ratio / Industry average P/E ratio)

Description: Stocks with low historical volatility will outperform in a bull market due to reduced risk aversion.
Technology stocks will outperform other sectors during bull market phases.
Expression: Signal = (Technology sector index return) - (Overall market index return)

Description: Stocks with significantly increased trading volume will outperform in a bull market.
High beta stocks will outperform in a bull market.
Stocks with low beta offer relative protection during bear markets.
Gold prices will positively correlate with market declines.
Stocks with decreased volume may indicate less selling pressure compared to peers.
Expression: Signal = (10-day average volume / Current day volume)

Description: A significant positive shift in news sentiment after a positive earnings surprise predicts further upward price movement.
Expression: Signal = SentimentScore[t+1] - SentimentScore[t] (where SentimentScore is a composite measure from news articles)

Description: The probability of an analyst rating upgrade after a positive earnings surprise is positively correlated with subsequent returns.
Stocks that miss earnings expectations exhibit negative momentum for a longer period than stocks that beat expectations.
Higher earnings quality coupled with lower post-earnings announcement volatility predicts stronger future returns.
A significant volume increase coupled with short interest data suggests a potential short squeeze.
Expression: Signal = Volume * ShortInterestRatio; //Higher signal suggests stronger squeeze potential

Description: Stocks with overwhelmingly positive news sentiment surrounding earnings announcements outperform the market in the following week.
High trading volume following an earnings announcement predicts continued price movement in the same direction.
Expression: Signal = Volume_post_earnings / avg(Volume, 20_days_pre_earnings); Higher Signal => Stronger BUY if Price_change > 0, Stronger SELL if Price_change < 0

Description: Stocks with strong upward revisions in future earnings guidance outperform the market over the next month.
Expression: Signal = (Revised Guidance - Prior Guidance) / Prior Guidance

Description: Stocks experiencing a significant P/E ratio contraction post-earnings show a price increase within two weeks.
When two highly correlated stocks show a significant divergence in their P/E ratios, their correlation is expected to decrease.
High short-term volatility in one asset of a highly correlated pair leads to a weakening of the correlation.
When a sector rotates out of favor, causing a price drop in one asset, its correlation with another asset from the same sector will temporarily weaken.

Sub_Hypothesis: Regression to the Mean in Correlation
Description: Extreme deviations of correlation from its long-term average are likely to revert to the mean.
High-momentum stocks showing declining correlation with the market will outperform in the next 5 days.
Increased market volatility before a Fed Funds rate hike predicts subsequent price declines.
Expression: Signal = VIX / (Change in Fed Funds Rate Expectations)

Description: Growth stocks underperform when the yield curve inverts.
Higher inflation leads to increased demand for commodities and inflation-protected securities.
Positive surprises in Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) readings predict stronger economic activity and higher stock prices.
Lower unemployment rates correlate with higher stock market returns.
High consumer confidence predicts increased consumer spending and higher stock valuations.
Sustained high volume over 10 days predicts further price increases.
Expression: signal = sum(volume[t-9:t]) / 10 if sum(volume[t-9:t]) > 2 * avg(volume[t-50:t-10]) else 0

Description: A sudden increase in the volume-to-price ratio signals a potential price breakout.
Expression: signal = (volume[t] / price[t]) - avg(volume[t-20:t-1]/price[t-20:t-1]) if (volume[t] / price[t]) > 2 * std(volume[t-20:t-1]/price[t-20:t-1]) else 0

Description: High volume on a low price day suggests a potential price rebound.
Expression: signal = 1 if volume[t] > 2 * avg(volume[t-20:t-1]) and price[t] < avg(price[t-20:t-1]) else 0

Description: High volume accompanied by decreasing positive sentiment signals a potential price decline.
Expression: Signal = -1 * Correlation(Volume, Sentiment, 10) if (Volume[0] > 1.5 * Avg(Volume, 20) and Sentiment[0] < Sentiment[1]) else 0

Description: Clustering of high volume days suggests a potential trend change.
A sudden increase in volume compared to the previous day indicates a potential shift in market sentiment.
High volume coupled with decreasing correlation to a market index suggests idiosyncratic price movement.
Expression: signal = 1 if volume[t] > 2 * avg(volume[t-20:t-1]) and correlation(price[t], index_price[t]) < avg(correlation(price[t-20:t-1], index_price[t-20:t-1])) else 0

Description: Smaller caps experiencing high volume breakouts above recent resistance levels outperform.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > 2 * AvgVolume[t-20] && Price[t] > ResistanceLevel) else 0

Description: Positive surprises lead to higher returns, especially if pre-announcement volatility was high.
High trading volume coupled with positive post-announcement sentiment predicts higher returns.
Stocks with high return on equity (ROE) are more likely to appreciate.
When the Relative Strength Index (RSI) falls below 30, a price bounce is likely.
Stocks experiencing a sharp price drop in the last 2 days are likely to rebound in the short term.
Stocks whose correlation with the market index has increased over the last 10 days will continue to exhibit higher correlation.
Prices touching the upper Bollinger Band (2 standard deviations above the 20-day MA) will revert to the mean.
Expression: upper_band = 20DMA + 2 * 20day_stddev(price); if (price > upper_band) then position = -1 else position = 0

Description: Stocks with dividend yields significantly above their historical average will show positive returns.
Agreement between changes in market sentiment and changes in volatility predicts market direction.
Expression: Signal = sign(SentimentChange_t) * sign(VolatilityChange_t); where SentimentChange and VolatilityChange are percentage changes.

Description: Changes in the put-call ratio, scaled by changes in overall market volatility, predict future returns.
Expression: Signal = (PutCallRatio_t - PutCallRatio_t-1) / VolatilityChange_t; where VolatilityChange_t is the percentage change in implied volatility.

Description: The ratio of high to low volatility over a given period predicts the direction of the market.
Expression: Signal = HighVolatility_n / LowVolatility_n; where HighVolatility_n is the maximum volatility over n periods, and LowVolatility_n is the minimum volatility.

Description: Large volume trades in liquid stocks have a smaller negative market impact on returns.
Assets with a shrinking bid-ask spread accompanied by increasing volume indicate improving liquidity and potential for price appreciation.
Expression: Signal = (BidAskSpread / AVG(BidAskSpread, 10)) * (Volume / AVG(Volume,10)); Buy if Signal < 0.5

Description: High-volume stocks that underperform in the short term tend to outperform the following day.
Expression: Signal = -1 * Return_{t-1} * Volume_t if Return_{t-1} < 0; else Signal = 0

Description: High correlation between trading volume and the volume of a related stock (e.g., in the same sector) signals future outperformance.
Large order imbalances coupled with high volume can predict short-term price direction.
Expression: OrderImbalance = (BuyVolume - SellVolume) / (BuyVolume + SellVolume); Buy if OrderImbalance > 0.2 and Volume > AVG(Volume, 10)

Description: Stocks exhibiting strong upward momentum throughout the week will experience a price decline on Friday.
Stocks tend to experience higher returns before major holidays.
Stocks that gained value before a major holiday will partially revert on the day after the holiday.
Increased trading volume on Monday suggests a stronger price reaction to weekend news.
The P/E ratio for certain sectors shows predictable seasonal changes.
A sharp drop in price following overwhelmingly negative sentiment predicts a subsequent price increase.
Expression: IF (SentimentScore(t-1) < -0.8 AND PriceChange(t-1) < -0.05) THEN PredictedPrice(t) = Price(t-1) * 1.02

Description: Positive sentiment has a stronger impact on price for companies with lower P/E ratios.
A rapid shift from overwhelmingly negative to positive sentiment predicts a price surge.
Expression: IF (SentimentScore(t) - SentimentScore(t-1) > 0.6 AND SentimentScore(t-1) < -0.5) THEN PredictedPrice(t) = Price(t-1) * 1.03

Description: Positive sentiment's effect on price is delayed by one day.
Social media sentiment amplifies the effect of news sentiment on price.
A strong upward trend in sentiment over five days predicts a strong price increase.
Expression: Slope(SentimentScore(t-5), SentimentScore(t-4), SentimentScore(t-3), SentimentScore(t-2), SentimentScore(t-1), SentimentScore(t))

Description: The difference between expected sentiment and actual sentiment predicts price movement.
The spread between the prices of two correlated assets, adjusted for dividends and other costs, will revert towards a historical mean.
Expression: signal = (price_assetA - price_assetB - carrying_cost) - average(price_assetA - price_assetB - carrying_cost, 30 days)

Description: A widening difference in P/E ratios of correlated companies will cause a mean reversion in relative price.
If two assets are cointegrated, deviations from the cointegrating relationship forecast a mean reversion.
A linear regression between two asset prices, updated regularly, identifies overvalued and undervalued assets based on residuals.
The correlation between a stock's price and a market index reverts to its long-term average.
Stocks where the 3-day momentum is greater than the 1-day momentum will outperform.
Stocks within a sector exhibiting high positive correlation with the sector index will continue to rise.
Stocks with significantly lower analyst ratings than their historical average will outperform.

Group_Hypothesis: Liquidity Drying Up and Price Decreases
Description: A sudden decrease in trading volume coupled with negative price momentum signals a potential sell-off.
Increased trading volume predicts increased price volatility in the near future.
Expression: Signal = Volatility(t) / Avg(Volume(t-n:t)); if Signal > Threshold then Sell (short volatility)

Description: Assets that deviate significantly from their 20-day moving average, while exhibiting high volume, are likely to revert.
High volume in an asset increases its correlation with the rest of its sector in the following day.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(Asset_Price(t+1), Sector_Index(t+1)) if Volume(t) > 2*Avg(Volume(t-20:t-1)) else 0

Description: A strong negative sentiment shift is followed by a short-term price increase, and vice-versa.
Strong positive sentiment coupled with high trading volume predicts near-term price increases.
Expression: Signal = SentimentScore * Volume ; Buy if Signal > Threshold

Description: The correlation between daily sentiment and price changes predicts future price direction.
A sentiment level exceeding a pre-defined threshold predicts a price movement.
Higher volatility is observed around major holidays.
Expression: Signal = Standard Deviation of Daily Returns (Holiday Week) / Average Weekly Standard Deviation

Description: Stock market performance exhibits cyclical patterns based on the US presidential election cycle.
Expression: Signal = Average Annual Return Based on Year Relative to Presidential Election (e.g., Year 1, Year 2 etc.)

Description: High-yield value stocks that exhibit recent positive momentum outperform.
Expression: Signal = (P/E Ratio) * (12-month Momentum); Long if Signal < Threshold

Description: High-yield assets that have recently underperformed relative to their historical performance outperform.
High dividend yield stocks with high trading volume outperform.
High-yield assets that are negatively correlated with the market will outperform during market downturns.
High-yield distressed debt with improving credit ratings outperform.
Increased news event frequency correlates with higher price volatility.
Expression: Signal = STDDEV(Price, 10) / AVG(Price, 10) * News_Frequency_10, where News_Frequency_10 is number of news events in past 10 days.

Description: Stocks mentioned in positive news articles show higher returns compared to those mentioned in negative news.
Expression: Signal = 1 if News_Sentiment > 0 else -1, where News_Sentiment is a score representing the aggregated sentiment from news articles.

Description: High short interest and positive news sentiment may trigger a short squeeze, leading to price increases.
A combined score of news sentiment and market sentiment predicts price movements.
Expression: Signal = 0.6 * Market_Sentiment + 0.4 * News_Sentiment where Market_Sentiment and News_Sentiment are normalized scores between -1 and 1.

Description: A sudden surge in social media volume about a stock, regardless of sentiment, predicts increased volatility.
Expression: Signal =  stddev(Price) if SocialMediaVolume > Threshold * avg(SocialMediaVolume); else Signal = 0

Description: Positive news sentiment lags price increases by one day.
Expression: Signal = Price[t+1] - Price[t] if NewsSentiment[t] > Threshold; else Signal = 0

Description: Overly bullish sentiment predicts a short-term price correction.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (BullishSentiment - BearishSentiment) if (BullishSentiment - BearishSentiment) > Threshold; else Signal = 0

Description: Divergence between the Fear & Greed Index and price movement suggests a reversal.
Expression: Signal =  -1 * Correlation(FearGreedIndex, Price) if abs(Correlation(FearGreedIndex, Price)) < Threshold; else Signal = 0

Description: The weighted average of sentiment scores, weighted by trading volume, predicts price direction.
High P/E ratio combined with negative sentiment predicts a price drop.
Expression: Signal = -1 if P/E > Threshold AND Sentiment < Threshold2; else Signal = 0

Description: A high correlation between short interest and negative sentiment predicts a short squeeze.
Expression: Signal =  1 if Correlation(ShortInterest, NegativeSentiment) > Threshold; else Signal = 0

Description: High sentiment volatility predicts higher price volatility.
Expression: Signal = stddev(Sentiment) * k where k is a constant

Description: Weighting news sentiment by source reliability predicts price movement more accurately.
Unexpectedly high volume on a price breakout above a key resistance level suggests sustained upward momentum.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume > 2 * Avg(Volume, 20) && Close > ResistanceLevel) else 0

Description: A significant price drop on unusually low volume indicates a lack of selling pressure and potential price recovery.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Close < SupportLevel && Volume < 0.5 * Avg(Volume, 20)) else 0

Description: A sudden and significant drop in volume after a period of high volume may signal a change in trend.
Expression: Signal = -1 if (Volume < 0.25 * Avg(Volume, 10) && Avg(Volume, 10) > 2 * Avg(Volume, 20)) else 0

Description: When volume significantly deviates from the market's average volume, it suggests independent price action.
High volume with a significant increase in P/E ratio predicts potential short-term price decline.
Expression: Signal = -1 if (Volume > 1.5 * Avg(Volume, 20) && (PERatio[0] - PERatio[-5]) / PERatio[-5] > 0.1) else 0

Description: When the beta of an asset relative to the market deviates significantly from its historical average, a reversion to the mean is expected.
The recent change in the spread between a pair of stocks predicts future spread movements.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: The difference between the index weights of two highly correlated assets can predict short-term price discrepancies.
Sectors with high dispersion in Price-to-Earnings ratios will see mean reversion in valuation.
Expression: Signal = Standard Deviation of Sector P/E Ratios

Description: Stocks with significantly positive residuals from a multi-factor model will outperform.
Expression: Signal = Residual from Factor Model Regression

Description: The relative strength of growth stocks versus value stocks predicts their future performance relative to each other.
Stocks with high Price-to-Earnings ratios and rising prices will outperform stocks with low P/E ratios and falling prices.
Stocks exceeding revenue expectations by a large margin will outperform those that miss or only slightly exceed expectations.
Stocks experiencing upward revisions in earnings estimates will outperform stocks with downward revisions.
Stocks exhibiting accelerating sales growth will outperform those with decelerating or stagnant sales growth.
Stocks with a high positive sentiment score from news articles and social media will outperform those with negative sentiment.
Stocks with low correlation to the overall market will outperform highly correlated stocks during periods of high market volatility.
Companies with high return on equity (ROE) will outperform companies with low ROE.
Stocks upgraded by analysts will outperform stocks downgraded by analysts.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Analyst_Rating_Upgrade else -1 if Analyst_Rating_Downgrade else 0

Description: Stocks with significant insider buying will outperform stocks with significant insider selling.
Stocks with high projected future earnings growth will outperform stocks with low projected future earnings growth.
Stocks with the lowest volatility ranking over the past month tend to outperform stocks with higher volatility rankings over the next month.
Stocks with historically low volatility but high P/E ratios tend to experience negative returns following an earnings announcement.
Larger earnings surprises are associated with higher price volatility in the following 2 days.
The magnitude of the earnings surprise predicts trading volume on the announcement day.
Positive surprises lead to a higher P/E ratio 10 days after the announcement.
Large surprises increase the correlation of the stock with its sector peers.
Negative surprises are followed by a positive price change the next day.
Positive surprises enhance the upward trend over the next 30 days.
The magnitude of the earnings surprise predicts subsequent analyst EPS revisions.
Following a significant volume spike, a 10% price drop within 48 hours suggests a potential short-term selling opportunity.
Expression: IF (Volume[t-1] > AVG(Volume[t-20:t-1]) * 3 AND Price[t] < Price[t-1] * 0.9) THEN Short ELSE Hold

Description: A significant gap up in price accompanied by a high volume confirms the bullish signal.
Expression: IF (Price[t] > Price[t-1] * 1.03 AND Volume[t] > AVG(Volume[t-20:t]) * 2) THEN Buy ELSE Hold

Description: A volume spike for a stock that is positively correlated with its sector indicates strong sector-wide momentum, increasing the probability of continued price increase.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > AVG(Volume[t-20:t]) * 2 AND Correlation(StockPrice, SectorIndex)[t-5:t] > 0.7) THEN Buy ELSE Hold

Description: A weighted average of news sentiment and market sentiment predicts short-term price movement.
A breakout from a falling wedge pattern with increasing volume signals a price increase.
Expression: IF (fallingWedgePatternDetected() == TRUE) AND (price[t] > wedgeUpperBound) AND (volume[t] > avg(volume[t-10:t])) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: A bullish engulfing candlestick pattern suggests a potential bullish trend reversal.
Expression: Signal = 1 if BullishEngulfingPatternDetected(Candlesticks); Signal = 0 otherwise. (Requires candlestick pattern recognition)

Description: A bearish engulfing candlestick pattern suggests a potential bearish trend reversal.
Expression: Signal = -1 if BearishEngulfingPatternDetected(Candlesticks); Signal = 0 otherwise. (Requires candlestick pattern recognition)

Description: A sustained price move above the 200-day moving average with increasing volume suggests a strong bullish trend.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Price(t) > MA(Price, 200)) & (Volume(t) > AvgVolume(100)) & (Price(t-10) > MA(Price, 200)); Signal = 0 otherwise

Description: Companies with consistently high return on equity (ROE) over the past five years will outperform.
Expression: avg(ROE(t-5), ROE(t-4), ROE(t-3), ROE(t-2), ROE(t-1)) > threshold

Description: Companies with consistently increasing earnings per share (EPS) over the past five years will outperform.
Expression: stddev(EPS(t-5), EPS(t-4), EPS(t-3), EPS(t-2), EPS(t-1)) < threshold & all(EPS(t-i) > EPS(t-i-1) for i in [1, 4])

Description: Companies with CEOs who have served for a long time will outperform.
Companies with strong brand recognition and high customer loyalty will outperform.
A rapid decrease in implied volatility is followed by a period of lower realised volatility.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The basis between an ETF and its underlying stocks will mean revert to zero.
Expression: Signal = ETFPrice - (Sum(UnderlyingStockPrices * Weights) ); Trade if |Signal| > Threshold

Description: The price difference between an index fund and the underlying index will remain within a narrow band.

Description: A higher forward premium on the high-yield currency indicates greater potential profit from the carry trade.
A recent significant decrease in the interest rate differential predicts a near-term increase in the high-yield currency.
Positive macroeconomic sentiment towards the high-yield country enhances carry trade returns.
Steeper yield curves in the high-yielding currency enhance carry trade profitability.
Stocks that have performed well recently will continue to outperform in a bull market.
In bear markets, low P/E ratio stocks in defensive sectors outperform.

Description: Recently underperforming stocks outperform in a bear market.
Positive earnings surprises lead to sustained positive price momentum over the following 10 days.

Description: Breakouts above a significant resistance level on low volume in illiquid stocks are often followed by a price decline.
Expression: Signal = -1 if (Price_t > Resistance_Level) & (Volume_t < threshold); else Signal = 0

Description: Significant insider buying in low-liquidity stocks can signal positive future price movements, but with a delayed effect.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Insider_Buying_t > threshold) & (Volume_t < threshold); else Signal = 0

Description: Positive earnings surprises generate momentum, leading to continued price increases in the following days.
Expression: Signal =  average(daily_return[t+1:t+5])  where t is announcement day

Description: Extreme positive PEAD is followed by price reversion.

Description: Larger trading volume on the announcement day amplifies the price reaction to the earnings surprise.
Positive sentiment before earnings announcements strengthens the positive price reaction to positive surprises.
The magnitude of P/E ratio change following an earnings surprise predicts the subsequent price movement.
Expression: signal = (newPERatio - oldPERatio) * earningsSurprise;  adjustment = signal / oldPERatio

Description: High VIX values tend to be followed by further periods of high VIX values.
High volatility stocks with unusually low correlation to the market are expected to experience a mean reversion in correlation.
Negative news about one asset while its correlation with another asset remains high will cause an under-reaction in the price of the correlated asset.
When the correlation between two historically correlated stocks deviates significantly, a mean reversion trade is implemented.
Stocks with unexpectedly low correlation to the market during a macroeconomic event will see a reversion post-event.
Expression: Signal = IF(Macroeconomic_Event == TRUE, (Average(Correlation(Stock_Price, Market_Price), 20) - Correlation(Stock_Price, Market_Price)), 0)

Description: Stocks showing positive sentiment but unusually low correlation to the market will experience a correlation increase.
Stocks with unusually low P/E ratios and low correlation are expected to show a correlation increase.
Stocks showing deviations from their long-term average correlation to a benchmark index will revert.
Expression: Signal = (Average(Correlation(Stock_Price, Benchmark_Index), 252) - Correlation(Stock_Price, Benchmark_Index)) / StdDev(Correlation(Stock_Price, Benchmark_Index), 252)

Description: Long-duration bonds underperform when real interest rates rise unexpectedly.
Changes in the PPI lead changes in the CPI, allowing for anticipatory trading.
Expression: Signal = PPI_change / CPI_change; Buy if Signal > 1 and trend positive

Description: Unexpected changes in the Fed Funds rate affect different asset classes differently.
Expression: Signal = (Asset_Return_Change / FedFundsRate_Change);  Buy asset if Signal > Threshold and change positive

Description: Bonds with shorter durations outperform during rising interest rate environments.
Expression: Signal = - Duration * InterestRate_Change; Buy bonds with Signal > Threshold

Description: A high term premium indicates investors expect higher future interest rates.
Expression: Signal = LongTermYield - ShortTermYield - ExpectedInflation; Buy if Signal > Threshold

Description: A sudden increase in the volume-to-price ratio predicts a short-term price reversal.
High volume accompanied by low price change suggests a period of consolidation before a price breakout in the coming days.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[0] > 1.5 * Avg(Volume, 20) and Abs(PriceChange[0]) < 0.01 * Price[0]) else 0

Description: The price momentum after a significant volume spike correlates with future price direction.
A sudden increase in volume correlated with a decline in price-volume correlation signals a potential trend change.
Expression: signal = (Volume - mean(Volume, 20)) * (1 - corr(Price, Volume, 20)) if Volume > 2 * mean(Volume, 20) else 0

Description: A volume spike combined with a low P/E ratio suggests potential undervaluation and future price appreciation.
Expression: signal = (Volume / mean(Volume, 20)) * (1 / P_E) if Volume > 3 * mean(Volume, 20) and P_E < mean(P_E, 50) else 0

Description: The difference between short-term and long-term volume moving averages predicts price movements.
Stocks with the lowest 10-day relative strength will outperform stocks with the highest 10-day relative strength over the next 2 days.
Expression: Signal = Rank(-RS_10day); //Rank stocks by 10-day relative strength (descending), lower RS for bigger losers

Description: Stocks experiencing a sharp deceleration in 3-day momentum will outperform those showing strong acceleration over the next 1 day.
Stocks in the bottom decile of P/E ratio will outperform the market in the next 1 day.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (PERatio < Percentile(PERatio, 10)) else 0; //1 if in bottom decile, 0 otherwise

Description: Stocks with the lowest correlation to their sector over the past 5 days will outperform those with the highest correlation over the next 2 days.
Expression: Signal = Rank(-SectorCorrelation_5day); //Correlation of stock price with sector index over last 5 days

Description: Stocks with the largest negative overnight returns will outperform stocks with the largest positive overnight returns over the next day.

Description: Stocks with high price volatility in the week leading up to earnings announcement underperform after the announcement.

Expression: Signal = -1 * Average Sentiment Score (day after announcement)

Description: A large increase in trading volume before earnings suggests future underperformance.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (Average Volume (past 5 days) / Average Volume (past 20 days))

Description: High volume deviations from the 20-day average volume predict a price reversion to the mean.
Expression: signal = (volume - SMA(volume, 20)) / stddev(volume, 20); if (abs(signal) > 1.5) return -signal; else return 0;

Description: High positive or negative correlation with a market index predicts a price reversion to the mean.
Expression: signal = corr(price, index_price, 30); if (abs(signal) > 0.9) return -signal; else return 0;

Description: Large spreads between bid and ask prices tend to revert to the mean spread.
Expression: signal = (spread - SMA(spread, 10)) / stddev(spread, 10); if (signal > 1) return -1; else return 0;

Description: Stocks with increasing trading volume over the past 20 days tend to continue their price momentum.
Stocks with a positive 50-day moving average and increasing 20-day moving average will continue to outperform.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (SMA(Price,50) > SMA(Price,20)) AND (SMA(Price,20) > SMA(Price,20)[t-1]) else 0; Rank stocks by Signal

Description: Stocks with high 5-day returns and low 20-day volatility (measured by standard deviation) are likely to continue their strong performance.
Expression: Signal = (Price[t] / Price[t-5]) - 1 - StDev(Price, 20); Rank stocks by Signal

Description: Stocks that break through a defined resistance level (e.g., 50-day high) will continue to rise in the following days.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Price[t] > Max(Price, 50) else 0; Rank stocks by Signal

Description: Stocks with a high positive correlation to the market index over the past 5 days are likely to maintain momentum.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(StockPrice, MarketIndex, 5); Rank stocks by Signal

Description: Stocks with high positive sentiment scores and strong recent price momentum will outperform.
Expression: Signal = SentimentScore + (Price[t] / Price[t-5]) -1 ; Rank stocks by Signal

Description: Stocks with positive earnings surprises will exhibit continued price momentum in the following week.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (EPS_Actual > EPS_Estimate) AND (Price[t] > Price[t-5]) else 0; Rank stocks by Signal

Description: Stocks trading below their historical average Price-to-Book ratio will experience price appreciation.

Description: A shift in option market skew predicts future price direction.

Description: Periods of high volatility clustering are followed by significant price moves.

Decreasing liquidity alongside improving market breadth signals a potential short-term opportunity.
