Description: A large volume increase with little to no change in price indicates potential upcoming volatility and a possible breakout.
A significant price gap followed by substantial volume suggests continuation of the directional move.
Expression: Signal = IF(Gap > Avg(Gap,20) AND Volume > Avg(Volume, 20), 1, -1)

Description: High volatility in news sentiment predicts higher price volatility in the near term.
A sustained shift to positive sentiment predicts long-term upward price trends.
Sharp increase in negative sentiment surrounding a specific event predicts temporary price drops.
Stocks tend to exhibit higher returns in the year leading up to a presidential election.
Expression: Signal = Average(MonthlyReturn) for the 12 months prior to a presidential election

Description: The premium of an ETF over its net asset value (NAV) will revert to the mean within five days.
Expression: Signal = (ETF_Price / NAV_Price - Avg(ETF_Price / NAV_Price, 5)) / StdDev(ETF_Price / NAV_Price, 5)

Description: ETFs with high trading volume relative to their underlying assets are more likely to experience temporary mispricings.
Deviations from a cointegration relationship between two assets will be corrected.
Price discrepancies between the same asset traded in different markets will adjust overnight.
Differences in bid-ask spreads across multiple exchanges for the same asset present arbitrage opportunities.
Expression: Signal = (Max(Bid_Price, Market1, Market2) - Min(Ask_Price, Market1, Market2)) / Avg(Price, Market1, Market2)

Description: A sharp deviation from the 50-day moving average will likely see a return to the mean.
Stocks opening at a higher price than the previous day's closing price tend to exhibit further upward momentum.
Expression: Gap = Price[t, Open] - Price[t-1, Close]; Signal = 1 if Gap > 0 else 0

Description: Stocks with a consistently upward sloping linear regression line over the past 5 days show stronger momentum.
Expression: Trend = LinearRegression(Price[t-4:t]); Slope = Trend.slope; Signal = 1 if Slope > 0.1 else 0

Description: Stocks experiencing high volume on days with positive price changes tend to outperform.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Price[t] > Price[t-1]) and (Volume[t] > Average(Volume, 20)) else 0

Description: Stocks with an RSI above 70 indicate overbought conditions, which might lead to a short-term price reversal.
Expression: RSI_14 = RSI(Price, 14); Signal = 1 if RSI_14 > 70 else 0

Description: Positive correlation between daily price changes and positive sentiment scores suggests sustained upward momentum.
Expression: Correlation = Correlation(Price_Change, Sentiment_Score, 10); Signal = 1 if Correlation > 0.5 else 0

Description: High dividend yield stocks, exceeding a threshold relative to their industry peers, will generate alpha.
Rising VIX predicts further near-term price declines.
Leveraged instruments will experience greater gains during periods of volatility decline and greater losses during periods of volatility increase.
Higher trading volume coupled with price swings suggests higher future volatility and potential short-term trading opportunities.
Expression: Volatility = STDEV(Price, 20) * (Volume / AVG(Volume, 20)); Short if Volatility > 2*STDEV(Volatility,60)

Sub_Hypothesis: Large Block Trades and Price Impact
Description: Large block trades exceeding a certain volume threshold often precede short-term price movements in the same direction.
Expression: Signal = 1 if TradeVolume > 1000000 and PriceChange > 0 else -1; Buy if Signal = 1

Description: Sectors with significantly higher than average volume may indicate a rotation and outperform others.
Expression: Rank = RANK(SectorVolume, Sector); Buy assets in top-ranked sectors

Description: Price changes relative to the average daily volume can predict future price movements.
Expression: AdjustedPriceChange = PriceChange / AVG(Volume, 20); Buy if AdjustedPriceChange > 0.01

Description: Crossing a predefined threshold of negative news sentiment triggers a sell signal.
Stocks with high dividend yields and low historical volatility outperform.
Expression: Signal = Dividend Yield / (Standard Deviation of Returns, lookback=252)

Description: Stocks with high dividend yields that exceed earnings expectations will outperform.
Borrow in a low-interest-rate currency and invest in a high-interest-rate currency.
Expression: Signal = (High-Interest Rate Currency Yield - Low-Interest Rate Currency Yield) - FX Forward Points

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Exploiting temporary mispricing between correlated assets
Description: A significant deviation in the beta of one asset from its correlated pair suggests an imbalance and potential price correction.
Differences between implied and realized correlations from options on correlated assets creates arbitrage opportunities.
Average daily returns vary significantly across different days of the week.
Expression: Signal = [Average Return (Monday), Average Return (Tuesday), Average Return (Wednesday), Average Return (Thursday), Average Return (Friday)]

Description: Positive news about a specific sector will lead to outperformance of that sector relative to others.
Expression: signal = sector_sentiment - market_sentiment; if (signal > threshold) then overweight sector;

Description: When sentiment and news events align (both positive or both negative), the effect on price is amplified.
Expression: signal = sentiment * news_score; if (signal > threshold) then BUY; else if (signal < -threshold) then SELL;

Description: A consistently improving sentiment score over 12 months is a strong indicator of long-term price appreciation.
Expression: signal = SLOPE(sentiment, 12); if (signal > threshold) then BUY; else SELL;

Description: A surge in positive social media mentions predicts a short-term price increase.
A significant negative shift in news sentiment predicts a short-term price increase.
A significant positive surprise in analyst sentiment predicts short-term outperformance.
Expression: IF (AnalystSentiment[today] > AVG(AnalystSentiment[-30]) + 1*STDEV(AnalystSentiment[-30])) THEN Buy ELSE Hold

Description: Positive news sentiment combined with a low P/E ratio suggests a buying opportunity.
Expression: IF (NewsSentiment > 0.5 AND P/E < IndustryAvgPE) THEN Buy ELSE Hold

Description: A large volume breakout followed by a price pullback with decreasing volume suggests a continuation of the initial trend.
Expression: Signal = (Volume > 2 * AVG(Volume, 20)) AND (Price < Price_High) AND (Volume_Current < Volume_Breakout)

Description: A sudden increase in volume preceding a surge in volatility predicts a significant price movement.
High volume despite negative sentiment suggests a potential short squeeze or contrarian opportunity.
When volume increases significantly and correlates positively with sector volume, it predicts sector-wide price movement.
Crossovers of the RSI indicator between sectors signal relative mispricings.
High beta sectors will underperform during market downturns and outperform during market upturns.
Stocks showing an increasing rate of sales growth will outperform stocks with decelerating sales growth.
Expression: Signal = (SalesGrowth_CurrentQuarter - SalesGrowth_PreviousQuarter); Buy stocks with positive and increasing Signal

Description: Stocks with a significant increase in positive analyst ratings outperform those with decreasing or stagnant ratings.
Expression: Signal = Change in Percentage of Buy Ratings

Description: High-growth companies with low debt-to-equity ratios outperform those with high debt-to-equity ratios.
Stocks with expanding gross margins over multiple quarters outperform those with stable or declining margins.
Expression: Signal = Average(Gross Margin Growth Q1, Gross Margin Growth Q2, Gross Margin Growth Q3)

Description: Low volatility stocks that show a significant decrease in their correlation to the market index will outperform.
Low volatility stocks with high betas will experience mean reversion in their betas and outperform.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (Beta_t - Beta_t-1); Beta_t = regression coefficient of stock return on market return over the last 60 days

Description: The magnitude of a positive earnings surprise predicts the strength of the subsequent price increase.
Larger trading volume following a positive earnings surprise predicts stronger subsequent price appreciation.
The magnitude of the post-earnings surprise volatility decrease predicts subsequent price increase.
A significant increase in positive sentiment following a positive earnings surprise predicts higher future returns.
Positive earnings surprises with high sector correlation lead to stronger sector-wide price increases.
The impact of an earnings surprise on price decays exponentially over time.
A high volume spike on a stock with a low P/E ratio signals a potential price rebound.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 3 * AvgVolume[t-20]) AND (P/E[t] < IndustryAvgPE) THEN BuySignal = 1 ELSE BuySignal = 0

Description: A volume spike exceeding a certain percentage above the average followed by a price decline indicates a potential shorting opportunity.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 1.5 * AvgVolume[t-20]) AND (Price[t+1] < Price[t]) THEN SellSignal = 1 ELSE SellSignal = 0

Description: High volume accompanied by a small price increase signals potential distribution by large holders.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 3 * AvgVolume[t-20]) AND (Price[t] < Price[t-1] * 1.01) THEN SellSignal = 1 ELSE SellSignal = 0

Description: High positive sentiment coupled with increased trading volume predicts sustained price appreciation.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment_Score_t * (Volume_t / Volume_avg_10); if Signal > 1.5 then BUY

Description: An extreme negative sentiment followed by a sharp increase predicts a strong price rebound.
Expression: signal = IF(Sentiment_t-1 < -threshold AND Sentiment_t > -threshold/2) THEN BUY

Description: A significant news event increases short-term price volatility, offering mean reversion opportunities.
Expression: Signal = std(Price_t-N:Price_t) / Price_avg_N; if Signal > 0.2 then short if price above avg else buy

Description: A breakout from a descending triangle pattern signals a continuation of the downtrend.
Expression: IF (DescendingTrianglePatternDetected(Price[t-n:t]) AND Price[t] < TriangleLow) THEN SELL

Description: A three-line strike pattern signals a reversal of a strong trend.
Expression: IF (ThreeLineStrikePatternDetected(Price[t-n:t], Volume[t-n:t])) THEN BUY (if downtrend reversal), SELL (if uptrend reversal)

Description: Companies with consistently increasing free cash flow will outperform.
Expression: avg(Free Cash Flow[t-4:t]) / Free Cash Flow[t-5] > 1.05

Description: Companies with an increasing news sentiment score will outperform.
Expression: Sentiment Score[t] > Sentiment Score[t-1] & Sentiment Score[t] > 0.5 (on a 0-1 scale)

Description: High volatility immediately following earnings announcements predicts subsequent mean reversion.
Expression: Signal = Average(Absolute(Daily Returns), 3 days after earnings); Short if Signal > 0.05

Description: The magnitude of the price change immediately following an earnings announcement is proportional to the earnings surprise.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS; Action = Buy if Signal > 0.1, Sell if Signal < -0.1

Description: Increased media coverage of a stock immediately following an earnings announcement is predictive of short-term price movement in the same direction.
Expression: Signal = Number of news articles in the 24 hours after earnings announcement; Action = Buy if Signal > 100 and sentiment is positive

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The implied yield spread between a bond and its corresponding futures contract will converge to a historical average.
Expression: Signal = (ImpliedYieldBond - ImpliedYieldFutures) - AverageHistoricalSpread; Buy Bond/Sell Futures if Signal > Threshold, Buy Futures/Sell Bond if Signal < -Threshold

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Deviations from covered interest rate parity between two currencies will be corrected through arbitrage.
Expression: Signal = (SpotRate * (1 + ForeignInterestRate) / (1 + DomesticInterestRate)) - ForwardRate; Buy currency with positive signal, Sell currency with negative signal

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Put-call parity violations provide opportunities for arbitrage profits.
Expression: Signal = (CallPrice - PutPrice) - (StockPrice - StrikePrice * exp(-rT)); Buy underpriced side, sell overpriced side, where r=risk-free rate, T=time to expiry

Description: The forward premium in high-yield currencies will decay towards zero, providing a positive return signal.
Carry trades in highly liquid currency pairs will have lower transaction costs and generate higher risk-adjusted returns.
Positive macroeconomic surprises in the high-yield currency will enhance carry trade returns.
Carry trades will benefit from aggressive interest rate hikes by the high-yield currency's central bank.
Stocks that beat earnings expectations will outperform those that miss.
Stocks exceeding earnings expectations will exhibit positive price momentum for three days following the announcement.
Expression: Signal = (Price_t+1 + Price_t+2 + Price_t+3) / 3 - Price_t; where Price_t is the closing price on the earnings announcement day

Description: Stocks with negative earnings surprises will exhibit a mean-reversion in their P/E ratio in the following week.
Expression: Signal = (P/E_t - AVG(P/E_t-5:t-1)); where AVG() is the average over the last 5 days, a lower signal indicates stronger mean reversion

Description: Positive sentiment scores from news articles after positive earnings surprises predict further price appreciation.
Expression: Signal = AVG(Sentiment_Score_t+1:t+3); AVG() is the average sentiment score (e.g., from 0 to 1) over the next three days

Description: Companies exceeding earnings expectations and raising guidance will outperform those meeting or missing expectations.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Earnings > Expectations) AND (Guidance_Raised == TRUE) else 0

Description: Short covering after a negative earnings surprise leads to a short-term price increase.
Expression: Signal = Short_Interest_Ratio_t+1 - Short_Interest_Ratio_t ; positive signal indicates potential short squeeze

Description: Stocks underperforming earnings expectations will show price reversion within five days.
Expression: Signal = Price_t+5 - Price_t;  Negative signal for negative surprise indicates stronger reversion

Description: Positive revisions to analyst ratings following positive earnings surprises predict higher returns.
Expression: Signal = SUM(Rating_Revisions_t+1:t+5); where Rating_Revisions are positive numeric values representing upgrades

Description: Negative sentiment scores coupled with low volume predict a subsequent price increase.
High-liquidity stocks with P/E ratios significantly above their historical averages tend to experience mean reversion in P/E ratios.
A narrowing of the bid-ask spread in an illiquid asset predicts a higher probability of a price change in either direction.
Positive earnings surprises lead to sustained upward price momentum over the subsequent month.
Expression: Signal = (Price(t+20) - Price(t)) / Price(t) (where t is announcement time and 20 represents trading days)

Description: Stocks with upwardly revised earnings guidance outperform those with downwardly revised or unchanged guidance in the next quarter.
Stocks with high-quality earnings (high accruals ratio) underperform those with low-quality earnings in the short-term.
A large increase in trading volume following an earnings surprise predicts continued price movement in the direction of the surprise.
Expression: Signal = (Volume(Day after Announcement) / Avg(Volume, 20 days)) * (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS

Description: A break above a long-term moving average of volatility signals a period of increased volatility.
Expression: signal = 1 if volatility > MA(volatility, N) else 0; N = e.g., 200

Description: The ratio of short-term to long-term volatility can predict near-term volatility increases.
Expression: signal = MA(volatility, short_period) / MA(volatility, long_period); short_period < long_period

Description: Stocks that enter a high-volatility regime (defined by a threshold) will remain volatile.
Expression: signal = 1 if volatility > threshold else 0; threshold = e.g., 2 * std(volatility)

Description: High implied volatility predicts high future realized volatility.
Decreasing correlation with a market index indicates upcoming higher individual stock volatility.
When the correlation between a sector ETF and the overall market breaks below its 3-month average, the sector will outperform the market in the following week.
Stocks with high positive correlation to the market but negative news sentiment will underperform in the next trading week.
Pairs whose correlation deviates significantly from their long-term average will revert towards the mean correlation.
Expression: Signal = long_term_correlation(price_A, price_B) - recent_correlation(price_A, price_B, window=20)

Description: High correlation between short-term volatility (e.g., 1-day) and long-term volatility (e.g., 30-day) is a bearish signal for the coming week.
When the correlation between US and European equity markets falls below a threshold, it signals a short-term opportunity in the relatively stronger market.
A widening gap between nominal and real interest rates signals future inflation.
The spread between nominal and inflation-protected securities reflects market inflation expectations.
A sudden decrease in the unemployment rate predicts improved market sentiment.
Expression: Signal = (Previous Month Unemployment Rate - Current Unemployment Rate) / Previous Month Unemployment Rate

Description: Increased momentum in housing starts signals increased economic activity.

Sub_Hypothesis: Sudden Volume Surge on Negative News
Description: A large volume spike immediately following negative news predicts a temporary price drop followed by a rebound within 24 hours.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[0] > 3 * Avg(Volume, 20) and NewsSentiment[0] < -0.5) else 0

Sub_Hypothesis: Unexpected High Volume with Low P/E
Description: High volume with an unusually low P/E ratio suggests undervaluation, leading to potential price appreciation in the next week.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[0] > 2 * Avg(Volume, 50) and PE[0] < Avg(PE, 50) * 0.8) else 0

Description: A significant increase in the short-term volume trend compared to the long-term trend suggests an impending price movement in the same direction.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Slope(Volume, 5) > 2 * Slope(Volume, 20)) else -1 if (Slope(Volume, 5) < 0.5 * Slope(Volume,20)) else 0

Description: When volume consistently stays low within the Bollinger Bands of the volume, followed by a large volume spike, expect a price movement outside the range.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (StdDev(Volume,20) < Avg(Volume,20)*0.1 and Volume[0] > 2*Avg(Volume,20)) else 0

Description: Stocks experiencing the largest one-day price drop will exhibit a positive return over the next two days.
Expression: Signal = Rank(1-day % change in price) * -1; Long stocks with negative Signal

Description: Stocks with the highest volatility (measured by ATR) over the past week will exhibit lower volatility and potentially positive returns in the next few days.
Expression: Signal = Rank(Average True Range (7-day)) * -1; Long stocks with negative signal

Description: Stocks that significantly reduce their debt-to-equity ratio will outperform.
Stocks experiencing high volatility around earnings announcements will see a reduction in volatility within the next 5 days.
Expression: signal = avg(abs(closePrice[t] - closePrice[t-1]), window=5) - avg(abs(closePrice[t] - closePrice[t-1]), window=20)

Description: High post-earnings volatility predicts a price reversal in the opposite direction within 3 trading days.
Stocks with overwhelmingly positive news sentiment surrounding their earnings announcement will outperform.
Expression: Signal = (Positive_Sentiment - Negative_Sentiment) / Total_Sentiment; Higher Signal => Stronger BUY

Description: A significant price increase following a period of high volatility suggests a bullish breakout.
Assets with consistently high volume over the past 5 days will exhibit higher returns in the following 3 days.
A MACD line crossing above its signal line indicates a bullish momentum signal.
Assets with high positive correlation to their sector index over the past week will outperform the sector in the next 2 days.
A recent increase in positive news sentiment predicts continued short-term price appreciation.
Assets with a decreasing P/E ratio in the last 5 days tend to outperform in the next 2 days.
Companies with low debt-to-equity ratios and increasing profitability will show strong price growth.
Stocks with high free cash flow yields compared to their market capitalization will produce above-average returns.

Sub_Hypothesis: Cash Flow to Price Ratio Strength
Description: Assets with a high ratio of operating cash flow to price will generate superior returns over time.
Prices tend to revert to the mean of the volatility-adjusted Bollinger Bands after a breach.
Expression: signal = (BB_mid - Price) / BB_stddev where BB_mid and BB_stddev are the mid-band and standard deviation of a volatility-adjusted Bollinger Band

Description: High volatility periods precede shifts in momentum, offering short-term trading opportunities.
Expression: signal = (Volatility_10D * Momentum_5D) where Volatility_10D is 10-day volatility and Momentum_5D is 5-day price momentum

Description: High volume follows periods of high volatility, indicating potential continuation.
Expression: signal = Volume_current / AVG(Volume_10D) where AVG(Volume_10D) is the 10-day average volume

Description: Extreme fear (low Fear-Greed Index) during high volatility periods signal buying opportunities.
Expression: signal = (Volatility_20D * (1 - Fear_Greed_Index)) where Volatility_20D is 20-day volatility and Fear_Greed_Index is normalized (0-100)

Description: Decreased correlation between asset classes during high market volatility suggests arbitrage opportunities.
Expression: signal = (1 - Correlation_XY) * Volatility_X where Correlation_XY is the correlation between assets X and Y, and Volatility_X is the volatility of asset X

Description: Sectors with lower volatility during periods of high overall market volatility tend to outperform.
High volatility combined with high P/E ratios signals potential for price corrections.
Periods of high volatility tend to cluster, providing opportunities to capitalize on continued volatility.
Expression: signal = Volatility_nD - Volatility_(n-1)D where Volatility_nD is n-day volatility

Description: Assets with high recent liquidity that experience a sharp price drop are expected to revert to their mean within five days.
The spread between the implied volatility of a highly liquid asset and a less liquid asset with similar characteristics predicts relative future returns.
Momentum strategies are enhanced by weighting assets based on their liquidity.
Expression: Signal = SUM(Return_{t-n:t} * Liquidity_t) where n is the momentum lookback period

Description: Highly liquid value stocks (low P/E) outperform less liquid value stocks.
Sentiment indicators are more predictive for highly liquid assets.
The beta of an illiquid asset relative to its liquid counterpart predicts future return spread.
A higher ratio of market depth to liquidity suggests greater price stability and lower future returns.
Assets with high liquidity relative to their trading costs generate higher risk-adjusted returns.

Sub_Hypothesis: Order Book Imbalance in Liquid Assets
Description: The order book imbalance (bid-ask ratio) in highly liquid assets predicts short-term price movements.
Expression: Signal = BidVolume / AskVolume (for liquid assets only)

Description: The impact of news events on asset prices is dampened by high liquidity.
When the correlation between a stock and SPY drops significantly below its 30-day average, a mean reversion in correlation is expected.
Assets showing increasing positive price change momentum over the past 10 days will outperform.
Assets with high positive sentiment and strong recent price performance will outperform.
Assets with recent negative price performance will experience a short-term price reversal.
A period of low volatility followed by a sudden increase predicts a subsequent price increase.
Expression: signal = (stddev(close_price, window=20) < 0.5 * avg(stddev(close_price, window=20), window=60) ) && (stddev(close_price, window=5) > 1.2 * stddev(close_price, window=20)) ? 1 : 0

Description: When the VIX falls below its 20-day moving average, it predicts higher future returns.
High volatility despite positive sentiment suggests an upcoming correction.
A higher skew in the volatility distribution predicts lower returns.
A sharp increase in trading volume is followed by increased price volatility in the short term.
A significant deviation from the historical correlation between price and volume suggests a potential price reversal.
Low volume periods followed by sharp price drops indicate a potential liquidity squeeze.
High volume coupled with an unusually low P/E ratio might indicate undervaluation and potential price increase.
High volume coupled with a significant imbalance between buy and sell orders signals a potential trend continuation.
High volume coupled with improving market breadth (e.g., advancing-declining ratio) strengthens bullish momentum.
Sentiment from reputable news sources carries more weight in predicting price movements.
Expression: Signal = (Weight<sub>i</sub> * Sentiment<sub>i</sub>) where Weight<sub>i</sub> represents source reliability.

Description: High-yield corporate bonds with a widening spread relative to government bonds will outperform.
High-yield assets tend to outperform during specific months of the year.
Disparate news sentiment scores for two highly correlated assets predict a price convergence.
A widening basis between the futures price and spot price of a commodity predicts convergence.
High news volume correlating negatively with price predicts a price rebound.
High trading volume combined with strong positive sentiment predicts higher returns in the next 2 days.
Expression: Signal = SentimentScore * Volume; // Product of sentiment score and trading volume

Description: Stocks with low P/E ratios and positive news outperform stocks with high P/E ratios and positive news.
Expression: Signal = (NewsSentimentScore > 0) ? (1 / P_E) : 0; // Inverse of P/E for positive news

Description: High P/E ratio stocks with negative news underperform the market in the next week.
Expression: Signal = (NewsSentimentScore < 0 && P_E > 20) ? -1 : 0; // -1 if condition is met

Description: High sentiment volatility tends to revert to the mean over the next 3 days.
Expression: Signal = AVG(STDEV(SentimentScore, 5), 10) - STDEV(SentimentScore,5); // Difference between mean and current volatility

Description: Increasing social media mentions with positive sentiment predict price increases.
High positive sentiment leads to increased trading volume, predicting further price increases.
Above-average volume followed by below-average volume predicts a price movement towards the 10-day moving average.
Higher volume on up days compared to down days over a period predicts continued price increases.
Expression: Signal = SUM(Volume[t-n:t] * (Price[t]-Price[t-1])) / SUM(Volume[t-n:t])  where n is the lookback period

Description: A price breakout above resistance accompanied by significantly increased volume predicts further price appreciation.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Price[t] > Resistance AND Volume[t] > AVG(Volume[t-n:t])*k) else 0; k > 1

Description: A sudden and sustained drop in volume after a period of high volume predicts a near-term price correction.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (AVG(Volume[t-n:t]) / AVG(Volume[t-2n:t-n])) where n is the lookback period

Description: High volume coupled with negative sentiment predicts a price decline, and vice-versa.
Expression: Signal = Volume[t] * Sentiment[t] where Sentiment[t] is a normalized sentiment score (-1 to 1)

Description: High volume with a declining advance-decline ratio suggests a weakening market and potential price drop.
A significant increase in the volume-to-market cap ratio indicates higher trading interest and potential price movement.
Stocks that experience a sharp price drop relative to their moving average will exhibit mean reversion momentum.
Price discrepancies between an index ETF and its underlying components offer arbitrage opportunities.
Sectors experiencing a sudden increase in volatility tend to underperform in the short term.
A high dividend yield relative to a benchmark will predict future outperformance.
Assets with high relative strength and low P/E ratios outperform assets with high relative strength and high P/E ratios.
Assets with high relative strength and increasing trading volume outperform assets with high relative strength and decreasing volume.
Assets with high relative strength and positive sentiment scores outperform assets with high relative strength and negative sentiment.
Stocks with high forward P/E ratios relative to their growth rate will outperform the market (within a growth sector).
Expression: Signal = Forward P/E / (Expected 5-Year EPS Growth Rate); Outperform = Signal > Sector Median

Description: Stocks with significantly higher sales growth compared to their industry peers will generate alpha.
Expression: Signal = (Stock Sales Growth - Industry Median Sales Growth) / Industry Median Sales Growth; Outperform = Signal > 0.2

Description: Companies with high revenue growth and low debt-to-equity ratios will outperform those with high debt.
Expression: Signal = Revenue Growth Rate / Debt-to-Equity Ratio; Outperform = Signal > 1

Description: A sudden increase in trading volume after a period of low volatility is predictive of positive price movement in low volatility stocks.
The magnitude of the earnings surprise is directly proportional to the subsequent price change.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS

Description: The price reaction to earnings surprise is higher for stocks with high beta.
The impact of earnings surprise is amplified if industry peers also report positive surprises.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) * Industry average earnings surprise

Sub_Hypothesis: Volume Spike and Relative Strength Index (RSI) Divergence
Description: A volume spike with a bullish RSI divergence suggests a potential price reversal.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-20, t-1]) AND RSI[t] < RSI[t-1] AND Price[t] > Price[t-1]) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0; Buy if Signal = 1

Description: High volume coupled with a positive Accumulation/Distribution (A/D) line indicates buying pressure.
Expression: IF (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-20, t-1]) AND AD_Line[t] > AD_Line[t-1]) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0; Buy if Signal = 1

Description: Stocks with overwhelmingly positive news sentiment will experience a short-term price increase.
Expression: IF (Avg(NewsSentimentScore, past 24h) > 0.7) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Extreme negative news sentiment coupled with high volatility leads to short-term price reversal.
Stocks with low P/E ratios and positive news sentiment exhibit stronger price increases.
Positive news released after market hours leads to a higher opening price the next day.
High short interest combined with positive news sentiment increases the likelihood of a short squeeze.
A breakdown below the lower trendline of a descending triangle pattern predicts a price decline.
A breakdown below the lower trendline of a symmetrical wedge pattern signals a downward price movement.
Expression: IF (WedgePatternDetected() == TRUE AND Price[t] < LowerTrendline AND Volume[t] > AVG(Volume[t-20]) * 1.2) THEN SELL ELSE NO ACTION

Description: A bearish divergence between price and MACD indicates a potential price reversal.
Expression: IF (Price[t] MakesHigherHigh() AND MACD[t] MakesLowerHigh() ) THEN SELL ELSE NO ACTION

Description: Positive guidance surprises lead to sustained upward momentum for at least 5 trading days.
Expression: Signal = (Actual Guidance - Expected Guidance) / Expected Guidance; Buy if Signal > 0.05, Hold for 5 days

Description: Stocks that show a decrease in correlation to their sector after an earnings announcement underperform.
Expression: Signal = (Pre-announcement Sector Correlation - Post-announcement Sector Correlation); Sell if Signal > 0.2

Description: A significant increase in P/E ratio post-earnings is unsustainable in the short term.
Expression: Signal = (Post-announcement P/E Ratio - Pre-announcement P/E Ratio) / Pre-announcement P/E Ratio; Short if Signal > 0.15

Description: Stocks with an analyst rating upgrade after earnings announcement outperform the sector in the subsequent week.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Analyst Rating Upgraded, 0 otherwise; Buy if Signal == 1

Description: Stocks exceeding revenue expectations by a significant margin outperform for the next two weeks.
Expression: Signal = (Actual Revenue - Expected Revenue) / Expected Revenue; Buy if Signal > 0.1; Hold for 10 days

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The price difference between an ETF and its underlying assets will revert to a fair value based on NAV.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The basis (difference between futures and spot price) of a commodity will converge to a historically normal range.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Options implied volatility will converge to realized volatility, presenting arbitrage opportunities.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Mispricings in the yield curve between bonds of similar maturity and credit rating will present arbitrage opportunities.
Expression: signal = yield_bondA - yield_bondB (where bondA and bondB are similar)

Description: Undervalued high-yielding currencies relative to low-yielding currencies lead to superior carry trade returns.
Stocks with high P/E ratios that have recently shown strong price momentum will continue to outperform in a bull market.
Expression: Signal = (P/E_t) * (Price_t/Price_t-1) ;  High Signal indicates strong momentum

Description: Stocks in high-growth sectors will outperform the broader market in a bull market.
Expression: Signal = SectorGrowthRate_t * StockReturn_t;  High Signal indicates outperformance

Description: Stocks experiencing a significant increase in trading volume alongside price appreciation will continue upward in a bull market.
Expression: Signal = Volume_t * Price_t; High Signal shows strong volume-price correlation

Description: Small-cap stocks will outperform large-cap stocks during a bull market.
Expression: Signal = (SmallCapReturn_t) - (LargeCapReturn_t); Positive signal indicates small-cap outperformance

Description: Technology sector stocks will outperform other sectors in a bull market.
Expression: Signal = TechSectorReturn_t - MarketReturn_t; High signal means tech outperformance

Description: Stocks with high positive correlation to the overall market will outperform during a bull market.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(StockReturn, MarketReturn); Higher correlation indicates stronger market following

Description: Positive earnings surprises lead to an upward adjustment of the stock's beta over the next quarter.
The magnitude of post-earnings drift is higher when the market is trending downwards.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS * (ClosePrice_t+5 - ClosePrice_t) / ClosePrice_t * (1 - MarketReturn_t+5)

Description: Wide bid-ask spreads in illiquid markets create opportunities by buying at the bid and selling at the ask.
Expression: Signal = (Ask[t] - Bid[t]) / Bid[t] if Volume[t] < 0.1 * Avg(Volume[t-100:t]); else Signal = 0

Description: Stocks that beat EPS expectations will exhibit positive momentum for the following week.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS * (Weekly Price Change)

Description: Stocks that beat revenue expectations will experience price reversion to the mean over the next 5 days.
Expression: Signal = (Actual Revenue - Expected Revenue) / Expected Revenue * (5-Day MA Price - Current Price)

Description: Positive guidance revisions will lead to higher returns than negative revisions in the following month.
Expression: Signal = (Positive Guidance Change - Negative Guidance Change) * Monthly Return

Description: Post-earnings announcement volatility will decay exponentially over the next 5 trading days.
A large volume spike on the earnings announcement day predicts a price reversal in the following 2 days.
Expression: Signal = (Announcement Day Volume / Average Volume) * (2-Day Price Change)

Description: Positive news sentiment surrounding earnings announcements predicts higher returns in the subsequent week.
Expression: Signal = (Positive Sentiment Score - Negative Sentiment Score) * Weekly Return

Description: A high degree of positive analyst sentiment before earnings will lead to price reversion post-announcement.
Expression: Signal = Pre_Announcement Analyst Sentiment Score * (Post-Announcement Price Change)

Description: The ratio of EPS surprise to P/E ratio predicts short-term price movement.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS / P/E Ratio

Description: Positive EPS surprises lead to P/E expansion, while negative surprises lead to contraction.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS * (Change in P/E Ratio)

Description: The correlation between a stock's price and its sector's average price changes after earnings announcements predicts its future performance.
Expression: Signal = (Correlation(Stock Price, Sector Average Price) - Pre-Announcement Correlation) * Future Return

Description: Large absolute differences between consecutive days' volatility revert toward the mean.
High correlation between asset's volatility and VIX implies persistence of high volatility.
If volatility exceeds a threshold, it's likely to persist above that threshold for a short period.
A sudden, short-lived surge in correlation between two assets, followed by a sharp decline, suggests a contrarian short position.
A crossover of the 20-day moving average of asset correlation signals a shift in market dynamics.
A deviation of a specific asset's correlation with its sector from its historical average creates a trading opportunity.
A gradual decrease in the long-term correlation between two assets signals a potential short-term divergence in their prices.
Unexpected increases in short-term interest rates negatively impact growth stocks.
Expression: Signal = (Current Fed Funds Rate - Previous Month Fed Funds Rate) / Previous Month Fed Funds Rate

Description: Rising inflation negatively impacts bond prices and some equity sectors.
Expression: Signal = CPI Inflation Rate - Average CPI Inflation Rate (past 12 months)

Description: A widening gap between nominal and inflation-adjusted interest rates predicts market volatility.
Expression: Signal = Nominal Interest Rate - Inflation Rate

Description: High and rising bond yields predict lower future equity returns.
Rising consumer confidence predicts increased consumer spending and economic growth.
Expression: Signal = Consumer Confidence Index - Average Consumer Confidence Index (past 6 months)

Description: Increased housing starts suggest economic expansion and positive market sentiment.
Expression: Signal = Housing Starts - Average Housing Starts (past 12 months)

Description: A high VRS ratio, calculated as the ratio of volume to a moving average of volume, points to stronger price trends.

Sub_Hypothesis: Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) with Volume
Description: High volume confirming a MACD crossover suggests stronger price movements in the direction of the crossover.
An unusually large volume spike compared to recent history indicates potential significant price movement.
Stocks that had negative earnings surprises will outperform stocks with positive surprises in the following trading week.
Expression: EarningsSurprise = Actual_Earnings - Expected_Earnings; Signal = Rank(EarningsSurprise) * -1; Buy stocks with highest Signal.

Description: Small-cap stocks with low Price-to-Book ratios relative to their industry peers will generate higher returns.
Expression: Signal = 1 / (P/B_stock - avg(P/B_industry)), where avg(P/B_industry) is the average P/B ratio of the industry; Filter for small-cap stocks only.

Description: Small-cap stocks with low betas (low correlation to the market) tend to outperform during market downturns.
Expression: Signal = 1 - Beta; Filter for small-cap stocks only; Higher signal indicates stronger outperformance potential.

Description: The immediate post-earnings price movement will often reverse itself in the short-term.
The initial post-earnings price movement is a predictor of long-term price direction.
Stocks with upward revisions to earnings estimates prior to the announcement outperform.
Stocks with unusually high or low P/E ratios relative to their sector will experience price reversion following earnings announcements.
A sharp decrease in implied volatility (IV) after earnings announcements is associated with higher subsequent returns.
The correlation between a stock and the market index reverts to its long-term average.
10-day returns revert to their long-term average return after significantly exceeding it.
Assets whose price is significantly above their VWAP over the last 10 days will outperform.
Assets showing increasing positive returns over three consecutive 1-day periods will outperform in the next 3 days.
Assets with high positive price momentum and low correlation to the market will outperform.
Assets experiencing a significant increase in trading volume alongside positive price momentum will outperform.
Stocks trading at a significantly lower Price-to-Book ratio than their industry peers will generate excess returns.
Stocks with a CAPE ratio significantly below their long-term average outperform those above.
Companies with high asset turnover ratios and low valuations will outperform.
High VIX implies increased fear, leading to short-term price declines.
High volatility in one sector spills over into correlated sectors.
Increased option skew predicts increased future volatility.
Negative sentiment coupled with high volatility predicts further declines.
Increasing volatility suggests a continuation of the price trend.
A sudden surge in trading volume, followed by a decline, predicts a negative return.
When positive sentiment diverges from decreasing liquidity, it suggests a negative price movement.
A decrease in market liquidity leads to increased correlation between asset returns, creating contrarian opportunities.
Value stocks with high liquidity will outperform those with low liquidity.
Strong liquidity combined with broadening market participation predicts positive returns.
Illiquid assets that experience large price changes during the day will show a partial reversal in the next period.
Positive news sentiment coupled with a rising advance-decline ratio suggests a bullish market.
The difference between expected and actual sentiment change after earnings announcement predicts price movement.
High 10-day Average True Range (ATR) will typically be followed by lower ATR.
Expression: signal = (10-day ATR - 30-day avg ATR) / 30-day avg ATR

Description: Companies with high debt-to-equity ratios that improve their leverage ratios will generate excess returns.
Companies with high free cash flow yield relative to their market capitalization will outperform.
Large trades exceeding a certain volume threshold lead to temporary price distortions which can be exploited.
High volume coupled with negative sentiment leads to further downward price pressure, whereas high volume and positive sentiment boost prices.
Correlation between asset prices increases during periods of high liquidity.
A strong positive change in average news sentiment predicts a subsequent price increase.
Lower trading volume and lower returns are observed during the summer months (June-August).
Expression: Signal = Average Daily Volume (June-August) / Average Daily Volume (Rest of Year)

Description: Increased selling pressure in December due to tax-loss harvesting leads to lower returns.
Expression: Signal = (Average Return in December) - (Average Return in November)

Description: Stocks with low beta and high dividend yield will outperform the market.
High-yielding assets with low volatility outperform high-yielding assets with high volatility.

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Equity Index Futures & ETFs
Description: The price difference between an equity index ETF and its corresponding futures contract will revert to its 30-day average over 5 days.
Expression: Signal = (ETF_Price - Futures_Price) - AVG(ETF_Price - Futures_Price, 30);  Action: Long ETF/Short Futures if Signal > Threshold, Short ETF/Long Futures if Signal < -Threshold

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Equity Index Futures & ETFs
Description: Higher trading volume in either the ETF or futures contract relative to their average indicates a stronger mean reversion signal.
Expression: Signal = (ETF_Price - Futures_Price) * (ETF_Volume / AVG(ETF_Volume, 30) + Futures_Volume / AVG(Futures_Volume, 30)); Action: Same as above based on Signal

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Equity Index Futures & ETFs
Description: The magnitude of contango (futures price > spot price) or backwardation (futures price < spot price) predicts a mean reversion.
Expression: Signal = ABS(ETF_Price - Futures_Price); Action: Long ETF/Short Futures in backwardation if Signal > Threshold, Short ETF/Long Futures in contango if Signal > Threshold

Group_Hypothesis: Correlation Arbitrage: Convertible Bonds & Underlying Equity
Description: The difference in implied volatility between the convertible bond and its underlying equity will converge to zero.
Expression: Signal = Implied_Volatility(Bond) - Implied_Volatility(Stock); Action: Long higher IV/Short lower IV

Description: The Z-score of the spread between two highly correlated stocks will revert to its mean.
Expression: Signal = (Spread - AVG(Spread, 120)) / STDDEV(Spread, 120); Action: Long underperformer/Short outperformer if Signal < -Threshold, vice-versa if Signal > Threshold; Spread = Stock1_Price - Beta * Stock2_Price

Description: The deviation between a currency-hedged ETF and its unhedged counterpart will revert to its average.
Expression: Signal = (Hedged_ETF_Price - Unhedged_ETF_Price) - AVG(Hedged_ETF_Price - Unhedged_ETF_Price, 90); Action: Long one/Short the other based on Signal

Description: The relationship between futures market contango/backwardation and inventory levels of the commodity predicts price reversion in the ETF.
Expression: Signal = (Futures_Price - ETF_Price) * Inventory_Level; Action: Long ETF/Short Futures if Signal > Threshold and Backwardation, Short ETF/Long Futures if Signal < -Threshold and Contango

Description: Low P/E ratio stocks experiencing negative news often offer buying opportunities.
Expression: signal = 1 / PE_ratio if (sentiment < -0.5) else 0; //Inverse of P/E if sentiment is very negative

Description: Significant news events lead to increased short-term volatility, followed by mean reversion.
Expression: signal = -stddev(price_change, 5); //Negative standard deviation of price change in 5 days after news event

Description: Stocks with a low price relative to their sentiment score are potential undervalued opportunities.
Expression: signal = price / sentiment; //Ratio of price to sentiment score

Description: A small price dip immediately preceding a positive news announcement often presents a buying opportunity.
Expression: signal = 1 if (price[t] < price[t-1] & news_event[t+1] == 'positive') else 0; // 1 if price dipped before positive news

Description: High positive sentiment combined with high trading volume predicts stronger price increases.
High sentiment in undervalued stocks (low P/E) predicts higher returns.
Discrepancies between analyst sentiment and market sentiment predict price corrections.
The ratio of positive news sentiment to negative news sentiment predicts the direction of price change.
A sudden, large increase in volume followed by a significant price drop suggests a short-term price reversal.
Expression: Signal = -1 if (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-10:t-1]) and Price[t+1] < Price[t] - 0.05 * Price[t]) else 0

Description: Decreasing volume combined with positive news sentiment indicates potential for further price increase.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] < 0.75 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) and Sentiment[t] > 0.5) else 0

Description: Consistent high volume over several periods suggests a strong upward price trend.
Rising volume accompanied by increasing correlation with a benchmark index predicts further price gains.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > Avg(Volume[t-10:t-1]) and Correlation(Price,IndexPrice)[t] > Correlation(Price,IndexPrice)[t-1]) else 0

Description: A large percentage change in volume over five days signals a potential price shift.
The ratio of current volume to average volume, combined with price change direction, predicts future movement.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t]/Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) > 2 and Price[t] > Price[t-1]) else -1 if (Volume[t]/Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) > 2 and Price[t] < Price[t-1]) else 0

Description: High trading volume coupled with high price volatility suggests a potentially volatile future.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] > 2 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) and Volatility[t] > Avg(Volatility[t-20:t-1])) else 0

Description: A significant drop in volume followed by a decrease in volatility indicates potential price consolidation.
Expression: Signal = 0 if (Volume[t] < 0.5 * Avg(Volume[t-10:t-1]) and Volatility[t] < 0.8 * Avg(Volatility[t-10:t-1])) else 1

Description: Outperformance of one sector relative to others will continue for a short period.
A sudden negative news event will lead to a temporary undervaluation of the affected stock.
Expression: Signal = (News Sentiment Score - Avg(News Sentiment Score, 7 days)) * Stock Price

Description: When implied volatility is higher than historical volatility, it predicts a mean reversion in volatility.
Stocks tend to have higher returns in the last few days of the month.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Day is in last 3 days of month, 0 otherwise

Description: When an asset's relative strength breaks above its 20-day moving average relative to its sector, it signals potential outperformance.
Expression: RS_MA20 = 20-day moving average of (Asset_Price / Sector_Index_Price); Signal = 1 if Asset_Price/Sector_Index_Price > RS_MA20, 0 otherwise

Sub_Hypothesis: High P/E Ratio with Justified Growth
Description: High P/E ratio stocks with high and accelerating earnings growth will outperform those with low growth despite the high valuation.
Stocks receiving multiple upgrades in analyst ratings will outperform stocks with downgrades or stable ratings.

Sub_Hypothesis: High R&D Spending with Revenue Growth
Description: Companies with high R&D spending coupled with strong revenue growth will outperform companies with low R&D or low revenue growth.
A sudden increase in trading volume for a low volatility stock signals potential future price appreciation.
Expression: signal = (volume - avg(volume, 20)) / volatility if (volume - avg(volume, 20)) > threshold else 0

Description: A positive shift in investor sentiment towards a low volatility stock predicts higher returns.
Positive earnings surprises lead to sustained price increases over the next week.
The immediate postearnings price reaction is often reversed within 3 days.
Larger absolute surprises result in more significant price movements.
A simple beat (positive surprise) or miss (negative surprise) signal predicts short-term direction.
Positive sentiment scores increase after a volume spike indicates buying pressure is sustained.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment[1] - Sentiment[0] if Volume[0] > 2 * Avg(Volume, 60) and Sentiment[0] > 0

Description: Stocks with high volume spikes experience a notable decrease in their P/E ratio within a week.
Expression: Signal = (PE[0] - PE[5]) / PE[0] if Volume[0] > 2.5 * Avg(Volume, 30)

Description: High-volume spikes followed by immediate price decreases indicate a potential short-term reversal.
Expression: Signal = -1 if Volume[0] > 3 * Avg(Volume, 100) and Price[1] < Price[0]

Description: Significant volume spikes at price levels create strong support or resistance levels in the future.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Price[0] > SupportLevel and Volume[0] > 2 * Avg(Volume, 50) else -1 if Price[0] < ResistanceLevel and Volume[0] > 2 * Avg(Volume, 50) else 0

Description: Significant news events cause immediate price jumps, providing a short-term trading opportunity.
Expression: IF (EventDetected(t)) THEN JumpSignal = Price(t) - Price(t-1) ELSE JumpSignal = 0

Description: Prices often revert to a mean after a major news event.
The combined impact of positive sentiment and a positive news event yields stronger price increases.
Positive news coupled with increasing volume suggests a sustained price increase.

Description: Index futures contracts will converge to the underlying index price at contract expiration.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Deviations from the implied cross-rate between two currencies will be corrected through arbitrage.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Post-split price discrepancies between adjusted and unadjusted prices will correct swiftly.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The price difference between an ETF and the weighted average of its underlying assets will revert to the mean within a day.
A strong currency exhibiting a large carry will experience a mean reversion in its exchange rate against the funding currency.
The price premium associated with liquid assets will decrease as liquidity increases.
A strengthening funding currency reduces the profitability of carry trades.
Stocks with a significant recent increase in positive sentiment scores will outperform.
Undervalued stocks (low P/E) show a recovery bounce in a bull market.
Stocks with a high positive correlation to the market index will outperform in bull markets.
High-growth stocks with low levels of debt will outperform in a bull market.
Highly liquid stocks will outperform less liquid stocks.
Companies with low levels of debt will be less vulnerable to market downturns.
Stocks with a negative correlation to the market index will offer some downside protection.
Stocks with decreasing trading volume alongside price declines will continue to underperform.
Positive sentiment shifts following positive earnings surprises predict higher future returns.
Post-earnings announcement analyst rating upgrades predict higher future returns.
Companies with high short interest that beat earnings expectations show amplified price increases.
Negative earnings surprises lead to increased short-term price volatility.
Positive guidance revisions after beating earnings expectations generate stronger upward price pressure.
Illiquid assets showing a sharp decline in correlation with a broader index are more likely to outperform in the short term.
Negative news events often cause an overreaction in illiquid stocks, creating a short-term buying opportunity.
Stocks with upwardly revised earnings guidance outperform the market in the following month.
A decrease in P/E ratio following positive earnings surprises leads to higher returns in the next week.
Expression: Signal = (Pre-announcement P/E Ratio - Post-announcement P/E Ratio)

Description: Stocks receiving analyst upgrades after earnings announcements outperform those that receive downgrades in the next 2 weeks.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Analyst Upgrade, -1 if Analyst Downgrade, 0 otherwise

Description: High P/E ratio stocks exhibit higher volatility persistence.
High-correlation pairs will show temporary negative correlation immediately after significantly different news events.
Expression: Signal = -1 * correlation(price_A, price_B, window=10) * abs(news_sentiment_A - news_sentiment_B) # Negative signal if news sentiments diverge

Description: Pairs with historically low correlation will show increased positive correlation during periods of high market volatility.
Increases in broad commodity price indices predict higher future inflation and benefit commodity-producing stocks.
Unexpected increases in the Fed Funds rate negatively impact growth stocks.
High volume days with unusually low price volatility suggest a potential reversal of the prevailing trend.
Increased volume without a corresponding change in correlation with the market suggests an independent price movement.
If the current day's volume is above the 90th percentile of the last 10 days' volume, it suggests a potential price move.
A significant volume increase confirming a gap up or down in price indicates a potential continuation of the trend.
The magnitude of a positive earnings surprise is positively correlated with the subsequent 10-day price return.
Expression: Signal = (EPS_actual - EPS_estimate) / EPS_estimate * 100 where EPS_actual and EPS_estimate are actual and expected EPS

Description: A significant increase in positive news sentiment in the week leading up to earnings predicts outperformance.
Expression: Signal = (SentimentScore_t - SentimentScore_t-7) where SentimentScore is a composite measure of news sentiment

Description: High short interest combined with negative pre-announcement sentiment predicts a post-earnings price increase.
Expression: Signal = ShortInterestRatio * (1 - SentimentScore_t) where SentimentScore is normalized between 0 and 1

Description: The correlation between post-earnings volatility and the magnitude of the earnings surprise is predictable.
Expression: Signal = corr(Volatility_t, abs(EPS_actual - EPS_estimate)) where corr is the correlation coefficient

Description: Price consistently trading above the VWAP suggests continued short-term upward momentum.
Expression: signal = 1 if price[t] > VWAP(price, volume, 20) else 0

Description: A sharp increase in OBV suggests accumulating buying pressure and continued momentum.
A Stochastic Oscillator above 80 suggests overbought conditions, potentially leading to a short-term reversal.
Positive 10-day price change predicts continued short-term outperformance.

Group_Hypothesis: Assets with low valuations (relative to fundamentals) tend to generate higher returns
Description: Companies with low P/S ratios relative to their sector will outperform.
Expression: Signal = (Sector Average P/S Ratio) - (Company P/S Ratio)

Group_Hypothesis: Assets with low valuations (relative to fundamentals) tend to generate higher returns
Description: Companies with high growth rates but low valuation multiples will generate higher returns.

Group_Hypothesis: Assets with low valuations (relative to fundamentals) tend to generate higher returns
Sub_Hypothesis: Free Cash Flow (FCF) to Price Ratio
Description: Companies with a high FCF to price ratio will deliver higher returns than their peers.
High volatility accompanied by unusually low volume suggests a potential price reversal.
Negative market sentiment combined with high volatility predicts lower future returns.
Assets with high implied volatility rank relative to their historical levels show negative future returns.
A higher negative skew in options implies increased expected downside risk and negative future returns.
Positive sentiment combined with low liquidity indicates a potential price increase after a short period.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment_Score * (1/Avg(Volume_10d)); if Signal > Threshold then Buy

Description: Low liquidity stocks that exhibit a high beta to the market during periods of high market volatility are likely to outperform.
Expression: Signal = Beta_t * (1/Avg(Volume_30d)) * Market_Volatility; if Signal > 1 then Buy

Description: Stocks with low liquidity experiencing negative returns in the past 2 days tend to exhibit a positive price reversal in the following day.
Expression: Signal = (Price_t-1 / Price_t-2 - 1) * (1/Avg(Volume_2d)); if Signal < -0.02 then Buy

Description: Positive news events will have a magnified effect on the price of low-liquidity stocks relative to high-liquidity stocks.
Expression: Signal = (News_Sentiment * (1/Avg(Volume_20d))) / (News_Sentiment * (1/Avg(Volume_20d, High_Liquidity_Stocks))); if Signal > 1.2 then Buy

Description: Stocks with a high bid-ask spread relative to their average volume will experience widening spreads, leading to price underperformance.
Expression: Signal = (Bid_Ask_Spread / Avg(Volume_10d)); if Signal > Threshold then Sell

Description: Periods of increased volatility in low liquidity stocks tend to be followed by periods of lower volatility, offering a mean-reversion opportunity.
Expression: Signal = Volatility_t / Avg(Volatility_30d); if Signal > 2 * StdDev(Volatility_30d) then Sell

Description: Positive earnings surprises have a greater impact on the prices of low liquidity stocks, resulting in higher returns.
Expression: Signal = (Earnings_Surprise / Avg(Volume_30d)); if Signal > 0.1 then Buy

Description: A high rate of change in price over a given period suggests continued price appreciation.
A stochastic oscillator above 80 indicates overbought conditions, potentially signaling a short-term reversal, while below 20 suggests oversold conditions, potentially signaling a short-term bounce.
A rising accumulation/distribution line suggests sustained buying pressure, indicating positive momentum.
Unexpected large increases in volatility lead to subsequent mean reversion in market prices.
Large buy orders followed by sustained high volume suggest further price appreciation.
Expression: signal = 1 if volume_t > 10 * avg(volume_{t-20:t-1}) and buy_order_size_t > 0.1 * market_cap else 0

Description: A rising market with increasing overall volume indicates stronger upward momentum.
High intraday volume followed by a sharp price increase in the morning will likely experience a price correction in the afternoon.
Expression: signal = -1 * (price_afternoon - price_morning) if volume_morning > 2 * avg(volume_morning_{t-10:t-1}) else 0

Description: Unexpectedly high volume on low-news days suggests information asymmetry and potential price moves.
Expression: signal = volume_t / news_score_t if news_score_t < 0.1 else 0

Description: High volatility in news sentiment predicts high future price volatility.
The correlation between past sentiment and returns predicts future price movements.
High positive sentiment combined with high volume predicts a price surge.
Expression: signal = IF(sentiment_score > threshold_sentiment AND volume > threshold_volume, 1, 0)

Description: Specific holidays show distinct market reactions (e.g., Thanksgiving or Labor Day).
Market volatility tends to increase during August.
Stock market returns are different depending on whether there's a presidential election in that year.
Stocks with historically high volatility will experience a period of lower-than-average volatility, generating positive returns.
Companies with high leverage ratios will experience a mean reversion in their returns over the next year.
Stocks with high earnings yield relative to the 10-year Treasury yield will outperform.
Stocks with a low price-to-book ratio relative to their sector will outperform in the long term.
Expression: Signal = (Sector Median P/B Ratio / Stock P/B Ratio)

Description: A widening spread in P/E ratios of two correlated companies signals an upcoming price adjustment.
Temporary deviations between the price of an index ETF and its underlying constituents signal arbitrage opportunities.
Discrepancies in cross-currency exchange rates relative to implied rates from other pairs create profit potential.
A linear regression model predicting the price of one asset based on another identifies mispricings.
Increased trading volume on Thursday afternoon could predict Friday returns.
Positive news sentiment lags price increases by approximately 2 days.
Expression: Signal = Corr(Price[t+2], NewsSentiment[t], 60); //Correlation between future price and current news sentiment

Description: Significant increases in trading volume after major news events are followed by a continuation of the price trend.
Expression: Signal = (Volume[t] / AVG(Volume, 30)) * NewsImpact[t]; //NewsImpact is a binary indicator (1 for major news, 0 otherwise)

Description: The tone of news articles predicts the direction of subsequent price changes.
Expression: Signal = AVG(NewsToneScore, 5); //Average news tone score (e.g., 1 for positive, -1 for negative)

Description: Extremely negative sentiment coupled with oversold conditions (RSI < 30) signals a potential short-term price bounce.
A significant lag between positive price movement and sentiment indicates potential overbought conditions.
Divergence between analyst rating changes and price movement signals potential mispricing.
A crossover of the Fear and Greed Index above a threshold suggests increased buying pressure.
High correlation between negative news sentiment and price volatility suggests increased risk.
A significant decrease in volume followed by a price increase suggests a potential continuation of the upward trend.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t] < 0.5 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND Price[t] > Price[t-1]) else 0

Description: Low volume before a significant price gap upwards indicates potential short covering and further price increases.
Expression: Signal = 1 if (Volume[t-1] < 0.75 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1]) AND (Price[t] - Price[t-1]) / Price[t-1] > 0.02) else 0

Description: A change in the relative strength trend (from down to up) signals a potential buying opportunity.
Expression: Signal = 1 if d(RS) > 0 and d(RS_prev) < 0 else 0; where d(RS) is the change in RS.

Description: Assets in the top relative strength percentile outperform those in the bottom percentile.
Expression: rs_percentile = percentile_rank(rs_of_all_assets); signal = 1 if rs_percentile > 0.9 else -1 if rs_percentile < 0.1 else 0

Description: Low-volatility stocks with low Price-to-Earnings ratios are likely to deliver higher risk-adjusted returns.
Negative sentiment during high volatility predicts lower returns.
Low volatility stocks with increasing volume indicate higher demand and potential price appreciation.
Periods of unusually high volatility in low-volatility stocks will be followed by a reversion to their average volatility, offering short-term trading opportunities.
The impact of earnings surprise is amplified for stocks with higher betas.
A stock that experiences a 3-day volume percentile exceeding the 95th percentile over the past year will experience a positive price return in the following 5 days.
Expression: IF (percentile(Volume_3day, past_year) > 0.95) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: High volume accompanied by minimal price movement predicts increased volatility and potential future price swings.

Sub_Hypothesis: Volume Spike followed by Gap Up
Description: If a large volume spike is followed by a gap up in price the next day, it indicates strong buying pressure and potential further upward movement.
Expression: IF (Volume_today > avg(Volume,past_week) AND Price_tomorrow > Price_today) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: A volume spike coupled with negative sentiment suggests a potential short squeeze and upward price movement.
Following a volume spike, a period of low-volume price consolidation signals potential breakout.
Expression: IF (Volume_today > avg(Volume, past_week) AND avg(Volume, next_3_days) < avg(Volume, past_week)/2) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Sub_Hypothesis: Volume Spike & Positive Correlation with Index
Description: A volume spike accompanied by a high positive correlation with the market index suggests a strong upward trend.

Sub_Hypothesis: Low P/E ratio with Volume Spike
Description: A volume spike occurring when a stock has a low P/E ratio signals undervaluation and potential upside.
The weighted average price change over 5 days, weighted by daily volume, predicts short-term price direction after a volume spike.
Expression: weighted_avg_price_change = sum( (Price_i - Price_(i-1)) * Volume_i , i=1 to 5)

Description: High P/E ratio stocks with negative sentiment are likely to underperform.
Expression: Signal = P/E * (-1 * SentimentScore); if (Signal > Threshold) then Sell; else Buy;

Description: A wedge pattern breakout suggests a continuation of the wedge's main trend.
Stocks exceeding earnings-per-share (EPS) expectations by a large margin will experience significant positive price momentum in the following week.
A large deviation in the P/E ratio immediately after earnings will mean revert to a mean over the next month.
Positive sentiment expressed during the earnings conference call will lead to a positive price movement in the following trading days.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: The price of an ETF will track its underlying assets with a small lag; deviations represent arbitrage opportunities.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Incorrect price adjustments after a stock split create temporary arbitrage opportunities.

Group_Hypothesis: Arbitrage: Exploiting pricing discrepancies between related assets
Description: Delay in price adjustments after a dividend payment creates a short-term arbitrage opportunity.
A higher overnight funding rate in the borrowing currency negatively impacts the carry trade profit and signals potential depreciation.
A higher implied volatility skew in the high-yield currency suggests higher downside risk and potential depreciation.
Future interest rate hikes in the high-yield currency increase the attractiveness and forecast an appreciation.
