Positive momentum in key macroeconomic indicators (GDP, inflation, etc.) for the high-yield currency increases the attractiveness.
A sudden decrease in available liquidity leads to increased price volatility.
A bullish MACD crossover predicts upward price movement in bull markets.
Expression: Signal = 1 if MACD_t crosses above Signal_t; 0 otherwise

Description: Positive earnings surprises accelerate pre-existing price momentum, leading to sustained upward price movement.
Negative sentiment shifts in low liquidity stocks, as measured by news sentiment scores, precede price declines.
Stocks with positive earnings surprises exhibit a positive price drift over the five days following the announcement.
Stocks with upward revisions to future earnings guidance outperform those without.
Stocks with an increase in the number of analysts issuing buy recommendations after earnings outperform.
Expression: Signal = Number of Upgrades - Number of Downgrades

Description: Stocks with lower beta following an earnings announcement show better risk-adjusted returns.
A high rolling standard deviation of returns predicts further high volatility.
A significant increase in the rolling volatility suggests a period of heightened volatility.
Positive correlation between asset returns and the VIX index predicts higher future volatility.
High trading volume precedes and accompanies periods of high volatility.
Assets with high betas tend to cluster together in periods of high volatility.
A short-term negative correlation between assets, coupled with unusually high volume, predicts a mean reversion in correlation and price.
Expression: signal = correlation_1d * volume_1d if correlation_1d < 0 else 0

Description: A weakening correlation between asset prices will predict a stronger correlation in their P/E ratios in the following period.
Divergence in correlation between assets within a sector compared to their correlations with assets outside the sector predicts sector rotation.
Deviations in correlation from a long-term average are expected to revert, allowing for profitable trades.
Companies with strong pricing power outperform during periods of high inflation.
Commodity-related stocks outperform during periods of rising commodity prices.
Unexpected interest rate hikes negatively impact growth stocks.
Longer-duration bonds are more sensitive to interest rate changes.
A widening credit spread indicates increased risk aversion and lower future returns.
Sustained high volume with sideways price action indicates potential future price breakout.
Expression: Signal = 1 IF (Avg(Volume_{t-5:t}) > 1.2* Avg(Volume_{t-20:t-6}) AND Abs(Price_t - Price_{t-5}) < 0.05 * Price_{t-5}) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: A squeeze in the volume Bollinger Bands followed by a volume breakout predicts price movement.
Expression: Signal = 1 IF (Volume_t > Upper_BB(Volume_{t-20:t-1}) OR Volume_t < Lower_BB(Volume_{t-20:t-1})) ELSE Signal = 0

Description: Stocks that have crossed below their 10-day moving average recently outperform stocks above their 10-day moving average in the following day.
Stocks positively correlated with their outperforming sector demonstrate stronger potential.
Stocks with positive earnings surprises will see a P/E ratio expansion in the following month.
Expression: Signal = (P/E_post_earnings - P/E_pre_earnings)/P/E_pre_earnings; if EPS_Actual > EPS_Estimate then Higher Signal => Stronger BUY

Description: Stocks with upward revisions to earnings estimates post-announcement outperform in the next quarter.
Expression: Signal = sum(Analyst_Revisions_post_earnings); Higher Signal => Stronger BUY

Description: Post-earnings, the correlation between a stock and its sector decreases, leading to independent price movement.
Expression: Signal = 1 - Correlation(Stock_Price, Sector_Index, 10_days_post_earnings); Higher Signal => Stronger BUY (if price movement is positive)

Description: Assets with positive price momentum coupled with high positive news sentiment will outperform.
Assets with strong negative 5-day price performance are likely to experience a short-term price rebound.
Stocks with positive earnings surprises and low P/E ratios will show superior returns.
Stocks with historically low Price-to-Sales ratios and recent price declines will rebound.
Expression: Signal = (1/P/S_t) * (Price_t - min(Price_{t-n}, ..., Price_{t-1})) where n is a lookback period

Description: Undervalued stocks (low P/B) with negative sentiment will outperform as sentiment improves.
Stocks with high dividend yields and positive earnings growth will generate alpha.

Sub_Hypothesis: Free Cash Flow to Market Cap Ratio
Description: Companies with high free cash flow relative to market cap will outperform.
Companies with low debt-to-equity ratios and high return on equity will outperform.
Stocks with analyst upgrades and high value scores (e.g., based on multiple valuation metrics) will outperform.
When the VIX is high, implied volatility of short-term put options is overestimated, presenting an opportunity to buy undervalued puts.
A contango market in VIX futures indicates an opportunity to profit from a calendar spread, buying near-month contracts and selling further-month contracts.
Expression: Signal = Price(Near-Month VIX Future) - Price(Far-Month VIX Future)

Description: High-beta stocks exhibit amplified price movements during periods of high volatility, creating short-term momentum trading opportunities.
Sentiment scores should be adjusted for volatility to identify genuine shifts in market opinion.
During high volatility periods, stocks with low correlation to the market tend to outperform.
Expression: Signal = (Market Volatility - Stock Volatility) / Correlation(Stock, Market)

Description: Historically highly correlated pairs become less correlated during high volatility periods; identify opportunities to trade the spread.
Expression: Signal =  Correlation(StockA, StockB) - Historical Average Correlation(StockA, StockB)

Description: A sudden surge in social media mentions predicts a short-term price increase.
Buy when sentiment is significantly below its moving average and sell when it's significantly above.
Expression: Signal = 1 if Sentiment[t] < Avg(Sentiment[t-n:t]) - k*StdDev(Sentiment[t-n:t]) else -1 if Sentiment[t] > Avg(Sentiment[t-n:t]) + k*StdDev(Sentiment[t-n:t]) else 0

Description: A sudden, large decrease in liquidity will precede a short-term price increase as illiquidity forces a temporary price correction.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (min(Liquidity_t-n ... Liquidity_t) / avg(Price_t-n ... Price_t)) where n is a short time window (e.g., 5 days)

Description: Strong upward momentum in liquid assets will persist longer than in illiquid assets.
Expression: Signal = Momentum_t * Liquidity_t where Momentum is calculated as a moving average of price returns

Description: Positive sentiment with decreasing liquidity will lead to a short-term price correction.
Expression: Signal = Sentiment_t * (-1 * Liquidity_t) where Sentiment is a measure of investor optimism

Description: The correlation between an illiquid asset and the market will temporarily break down during periods of high market volatility.
Expression: Signal = 1 - Correlation(Asset_t, Market_t) * Liquidity_t where Correlation is calculated using a rolling window

Description: A shrinking order book depth in illiquid assets suggests increased price vulnerability.
Large trades in illiquid assets will have a proportionally larger impact on price than in liquid assets.
A breakout above a symmetrical triangle pattern predicts a price increase.
Expression: IF (Price[t] > UpperTrendline AND PatternDetected('SymmetricalTriangle')) THEN signal = 1 ELSE signal = 0

Description: A flag pattern followed by a pole continuation predicts a price continuation in the pole's direction.
Expression: IF (Flag pattern detected) AND (Breakout in pole direction) THEN Continue in pole direction

Description: A cup and handle pattern followed by a breakout predicts a price increase.
Expression: IF (Cup and Handle pattern detected) AND (Handle breakout confirmed) THEN Buy Signal

Description: Stocks with P/E ratios significantly below their historical average are expected to revert to the mean.
Expression: signal = 1 if (P/E[t] < 0.8 * avg(P/E[t-n:t])) else 0  // n = historical period

Description: A price drop exceeding two standard deviations of the 20-day price range suggests a reversion is likely.

Sub_Hypothesis: Free Cash Flow to Price Ratio
Description: Stocks with high free cash flow to price ratios will generate higher returns compared to the market.
Negative correlation between VIX and prior returns predicts positive future returns.
High volume during periods of high volatility predicts negative future returns.
High P/E ratios during periods of increasing volatility predict negative future returns.
High realized volatility predicts lower future returns, with magnitude based on the difference from historical average.
Assets with consistently low trading volume underperform the market over the next week.
When price increases while volume decreases, a price correction is likely within the next 3 days.
A sustained decrease in trading volume signals impending price weakness.
Positive correlation between trading volume and negative sentiment predicts a price decline.
Positive news sentiment for an asset while its sector shows negative sentiment signals potential outperformance.
Stocks in sectors sensitive to interest rates will outperform when short-term interest rates are significantly higher than long-term rates.
Stocks with consistently high and increasing dividend growth rates will exhibit superior returns.
Stocks with high positive sentiment and unusually low volume are likely to experience price corrections.
Expression: signal = -1 * (sentiment[t] / volume[t]) //Inverse relationship between sentiment and volume

Description: Stocks with high P/E ratios and strong positive sentiment are at higher risk of a price correction.
Expression: signal = -1 * PE_ratio[t] * sentiment[t] //Negative signal if both are high

Description: Stocks with low P/E ratios and negative sentiment are potential buying opportunities.
Expression: signal = 1 / (PE_ratio[t] * sentiment[t]) //Positive signal if both are low

Description: Positive news headlines, lagged by one day, predict a price increase the following day.
Expression: signal = NewsSentiment_t-1; if signal > 0.5 then BUY else SELL

Description: A large gap between positive social media sentiment and negative analyst ratings predicts a short squeeze.
Expression: signal = SocialMediaSentiment - AnalystSentiment; if signal > threshold then BUY

Description: Price declines despite increasing volume suggests a bearish reversal, predicting further price decreases.
Rising volume despite falling RSI suggests weakening momentum and potential price reversal.
A bullish MACD crossover confirmed by increasing volume predicts a sustained price increase.
A weakening positive correlation between price and volume suggests a potential price reversal.

Sub_Hypothesis: Increased Volume with Low Price Change
Description: High volume with minimal price change may indicate increased uncertainty and a potential upcoming large price swing.

Stocks that underperform the index significantly in the short-term will outperform in the medium-term.

The ratio of the asset's earnings growth rate to the benchmark's earnings growth rate predicts outperformance.
Relative strength within a sector is amplified during sector rotation periods.
Stocks with high correlation to a high-growth sector index will outperform those with low correlation.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(Stock Returns, Sector Index Returns); Outperformance = 1 if Signal > Threshold, 0 otherwise

Description: Stocks combining high growth potential with low historical volatility will outperform high-growth, high-volatility stocks.

Description: Low volatility stocks exhibiting positive momentum over the past 3 months will outperform high volatility stocks with similar momentum.

Large positive earnings surprises lead to increased short-term price volatility.

Expression: IF (Float < 10000000 AND Volume[t] > 5 * Avg(Volume[t-20:t-1])) THEN Signal = 1 ELSE Signal = 0;  Buy if Signal = 1.

Description: A volume spike coupled with high volatility indicates potential for large price swings, either up or down.

Description: A volume spike occurring when a stock's correlation with its sector weakens signals potential for independent price movement.

Description: Prices tend to revert to their mean after a large volume spike, suggesting short-term mean reversion trades.

Description: Unexpected news events lead to short-term increased volatility.
High P/E ratio stocks with negative sentiment underperform.
Low P/E ratio stocks with positive sentiment outperform.
High positive correlation between sentiment and price across sectors predicts market-wide gains.

Positive unexpected guidance surprises lead to outperformance compared to the sector in the next 2 weeks.

Description: When the price difference between an ETF and its underlying stocks exceeds a threshold, the spread will contract.
Expression: signal = ETF_price - sum(stock_weights * stock_prices) ; if signal > threshold then sell ETF, buy stocks; else if signal < -threshold then buy ETF, sell stocks

Description: The price difference between a futures contract and the spot price of the underlying asset will converge before the contract expiration.

Description: A widening bid-ask spread in illiquid assets signals increased uncertainty and potential for short-term price dislocations.

Description: A large volume spike combined with a significant gap up in price indicates strong buying pressure.

Description: A volume spike followed by price retracing to a prior support level indicates potential buying opportunity.

Description: A higher volume of positive news articles after the earnings announcement predicts a price increase in the next 2 days.
Expression: Signal = (Positive News Count - Negative News Count) / Total News Count

Description: Stocks that gap up significantly on the earnings announcement day tend to continue upward momentum in the next 3 days.
Expression: Signal = (Open Price - Previous Day Close) / Previous Day Close

Expression: Signal = Number of upward revisions - Number of downward revisions

Description: High implied volatility tends to revert to the historical average.
Expression: Signal = (Average Implied Volatility - Current Implied Volatility) / Average Implied Volatility; Buy if Signal > 0.1, Sell if Signal < -0.1

Description: Stocks with significantly higher dividend yields than their sector average will outperform.
Undervalued stocks (low P/E) that exceed earnings expectations will see larger price increases.
Stocks with high earnings growth rates but low P/E ratios will outperform.
Undervalued stocks receiving analyst upgrades will outperform.
Undervalued stocks with low debt-to-equity ratios will outperform.
Undervalued stocks with improving sentiment scores will outperform.

Periods of high volatility followed by a decrease predict price increases.
High trading volume during periods of high volatility suggests further price movement in the direction of the trend.
High VIX combined with negative sentiment suggests further downward price pressure.
Expression: Signal = VIX_t * Sentiment_t (where Sentiment_t is a normalized sentiment score)

Description: Assets trading at a significant distance from their mean price, adjusted for liquidity changes, will revert towards the mean.
Expression: Adjusted_Mean = Mean(Price(t-n:t)) * (1 + k*(Volume(t) - Avg(Volume(t-n:t)))); Signal = (Price(t) - Adjusted_Mean)/Adjusted_Mean; if abs(Signal) > Threshold then Reversion Trade

Description: Unexpectedly high volume suggests informed trading, predicting future price movements.
Expression: Signal = (Volume(t) - Predicted_Volume(t))/Predicted_Volume(t);  if Signal > Threshold then Buy (if Price increased), Sell (if Price decreased)

Description: High volume accompanied by shallow order book depth indicates increased price volatility and potential for sharp moves.
Expression: Signal = Volume(t) / Order_Book_Depth(t); if Signal > Threshold then Increase Volatility Hedge

Description: Large trade volumes have a disproportionately large effect on price, offering short-term trading opportunities.
Expression: Signal = (Price(t) - Price(t-1)) / Volume(t); if abs(Signal) > Threshold then contrarian trade

Description: High volume in one sector relative to others signals potential outperformance within that sector.
Expression: Signal = (Sector_Volume / Market_Volume) - Avg(Sector_Volume/Market_Volume); if Signal > Threshold then Buy Sector

Description: Stocks that underperform on Mondays tend to outperform on Tuesdays.

Expression: signal = -1 if (volume_t < volume_{t-1}) and (price_t > price_{t-1}) else 0

Description: High trading volume coupled with a low P/E ratio suggests an undervalued asset likely to appreciate.
Expression: signal = 1 if (volume_t > avg(volume_{t-n:t})) and (P/E_t < threshold) else 0; where threshold is a pre-determined low P/E level and n is a lookback period.

Description: Strong positive correlation between short-term volume changes and long-term price trends suggests momentum.
Expression: signal = correlation(change(volume_{t-n:t}), price_{t-m:t}); where n is a short lookback, m is a long lookback.  Positive correlation suggests bullish momentum.

Description: High positive sentiment coupled with increasing volume predicts upward price movement.

Description: Positive news sentiment will lead to positive price changes.
High VIX values predict lower future market returns.

Expression: correlation = correlation(Asset_Price, Benchmark_Price); rs = (Asset_Price_10day_Avg / Benchmark_Price_10day_Avg) ; signal = abs(correlation - rs)

Description: Extreme values of short-term relative strength tend to revert towards the mean.
Expression: rs = (Asset_Price_1day_Avg / Benchmark_Price_1day_Avg);  rs_mean = mean(rs_past_20days); signal = rs_mean - rs

Description: Assets with the highest relative strength within their industry sector outperform the sector average.

Description: Stocks exhibiting strong sales growth combined with expanding profit margins outperform.

Description: Low volatility stocks with improving sentiment scores will generate higher returns.

Description: The price of a convertible bond will converge to its theoretical value based on its conversion ratio and underlying stock price.

Higher earnings quality following a positive earnings surprise correlates with stronger subsequent price performance.
A sustained increase in trading volume coupled with a price increase in illiquid assets signals a potential breakout.
Expression: Signal = (Volume[t] / AvgVolume[Past_30_Days]) * (ClosePrice[t] - ClosePrice[t-1]) if Volume[t] > AvgVolume[Past_30_Days] * 1.5 and ClosePrice[t] > ClosePrice[t-1] else 0

Description: A positive news sentiment spike in low liquidity stocks leads to a short-term price increase.
Expression: Signal = SentimentScore[t] * (1/Volume[t]) if SentimentScore[t] > 2 and Volume[t] < AvgVolume[Past_30_Days] * 0.2 else 0

Description: Significant insider buying in illiquid stocks, exceeding a certain threshold, predicts positive price movement.
Expression: Signal = InsiderBuyingVolume[t] / Volume[t] if InsiderBuyingVolume[t] > AvgVolume[Past_30_Days] * 0.05 else 0

Description: Illiquid assets showing high negative correlation with the market during a broad market decline will likely outperform during the subsequent recovery.
Expression: Signal = Correlation(AssetReturn,MarketReturn)[t-5] * MarketReturn[t] if Correlation(AssetReturn,MarketReturn)[t-5] < -0.5 and MarketReturn[t] < 0 else 0

Description: Higher trading volume following a positive earnings surprise predicts higher short-term returns.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS * (Post-Announcement Volume / Pre-Announcement Volume)

Description: Upward revisions to future guidance trigger short squeezes, leading to immediate price increases.
Expression: Signal = (Revised Guidance - Prior Guidance) / Prior Guidance * (Short Interest / Float)

Description: Stocks with downward guidance revisions experience a stronger sell-off than those with flat or positive revisions.
Expression: Signal = (Revised Guidance - Prior Guidance) / Prior Guidance * (Daily Price Change)

Description: Positive news sentiment after the earnings announcement predicts higher prices in the next 3 days.
Expression: Signal = (Positive News Mentions - Negative News Mentions) * (3-Day Price Change)

Description: Earnings beats lead to P/E ratio expansion in the following week for high-growth stocks.
Expression: Signal = (Actual EPS - Expected EPS) / Expected EPS * (Weekly P/E Change) * Growth_Score

Description: Changes in analyst ratings after earnings announcements predict short-term price movements.
Expression: Signal = (Post-Announcement Rating - Pre-Announcement Rating) * Daily Price Change

Description: Positive tone in the conference call correlates with higher returns over the next 5 trading days.
A stock's performance after an earnings announcement is correlated to its sectors performance.
High trading volume during periods of high volatility predicts sustained high volatility.
Negative market sentiment during high volatility periods predicts continued high volatility.
Low P/E ratios during periods of high volatility predict a reversion to lower volatility.
A sudden decrease in market correlation predicts a short-term increase in volatility.
A sudden jump in volatility is followed by a period of elevated volatility.
Increased option skew indicates higher future volatility.
High overnight volatility predicts higher volatility during the following trading day.
When the correlation between two assets with diverging P/E ratios weakens, an arbitrage opportunity emerges.
A linear regression on rolling correlation values predicts future correlation deviation and trading signals.
A weakening correlation between implied volatilities of two assets, suggests a long position in the asset with higher IV.
A divergence between the correlation of an asset pair in two different markets suggests arbitrage opportunities.
Rapid fluctuations in correlation between assets, detected at high frequency, signal short-term trading opportunities.
High-dividend yield stocks outperform during periods of rising inflation.
Steepening breakeven inflation curves predict outperformance of cyclical stocks.
Inversion of the real yield curve predicts underperformance of long-duration assets.
A widening spread between nominal and inflation-protected bonds predicts higher future inflation and outperformance of inflation-sensitive assets.
Stocks with high operating leverage outperform when PPI increases faster than CPI.
Companies with low wage exposure outperform when wage growth surprises negatively.
Domestic companies with limited import dependency outperform when import prices rise sharply.
Large volume gaps followed by positive price momentum signal continued price appreciation.
Increasing volume despite declining sentiment suggests a bearish trap and potential price rebound.
A large proportion of total volume concentrated in a single day suggests a potential reversal.
Expression: signal = Volume_t / sum(Volume_{t-n:t+n}) where n is a window of days

Description: A sharp volume spike followed by a sustained decrease suggests a price peak or trough.

Sub_Hypothesis: Correlation of Volume and Price Change
Description: A high correlation between daily volume and price change suggests a strong trend.
Stocks with the highest negative 10-day momentum and high recent volatility will outperform stocks with high positive 10-day momentum and high recent volatility over the next 3 days.
Expression: Signal = Rank(-10Day_Price_Change * Volatility)  where Volatility = Standard Deviation(Price, last 10 days)

Description: Smaller cap stocks with high volume on days with unusually low prices tend to generate higher returns.
Smaller cap stocks experiencing a significant decrease in short interest outperform.
Stocks with high postearnings announcement volatility will see a decrease in volatility within 2 days.
Expression: Signal = -1 * ATR(2); //Average True Range over 2 days. Higher ATR implies higher volatility, negative sign inverts for shorting high volatility stocks.

Description: A significant increase in trading volume immediately following the announcement predicts short-term price movement in the direction of the volume change.
Expression: Signal = (Volume_Post - Volume_Pre) / Volume_Pre; if Signal > 2 then BUY if EPS_Actual > EPS_Estimate else SELL if EPS_Actual < EPS_Estimate else HOLD

Description: Stocks with upward analyst revisions in the week before earnings will outperform the market in the week after.
Expression: Signal = sum(AnalystRevisions_PastWeek); if Signal > 0 then BUY else HOLD

Description: Stocks with decreasing correlation to their sector in the days before earnings will see higher volatility after.
Expression: Signal = -1 * (Correlation_Current - Correlation_PastWeek); // higher values suggest decreased correlation

Description: Stocks with low P/E ratios that exceed earnings expectations will outperform the market in the subsequent month.
Expression: Signal = (EPS_Actual - EPS_Estimate) / P/E_Ratio; if Signal > 0.05 and P/E_Ratio < 15 then BUY else HOLD

Description: The magnitude of price change over the last 3 days is positively correlated with future returns.
When the 20-day moving average crosses above the 50-day moving average, the stock price is expected to increase further.
Expression: Signal = 1 if MA_20D > MA_50D and MA_20D_{t-1} <= MA_50D_{t-1} else 0

Description: A higher ratio of the recent high to the recent low price suggests stronger short-term upward momentum.
Asset prices are expected to revert when the Relative Strength Index (RSI) reaches overbought or oversold levels.
Stocks outperforming their sector exhibit stronger momentum.
When a stock's price drops below its 20-day simple moving average, it's likely to revert to the mean in the short term.
RSI values above 70 or below 30 tend to revert towards 50.
Stocks that significantly deviate from their 100-day moving average tend to revert within a month.
The Relative Strength Index (RSI) will revert to its mean value of 50 after exceeding overbought or oversold thresholds.
Expression: Signal = (50 - Current RSI) / RSI Standard Deviation (20-day)

Description: When the short-term SMA crosses below the long-term SMA, a reversion to the long-term average is anticipated.
Expression: signal = SMA(Close, 5) - SMA(Close, 20); Buy if signal < 0 and signal > signal(-1)

Description: Extreme RSI readings (overbought or oversold) signal a price reversion.
Expression: signal = (100 - RSI) if RSI > 70 else (RSI - 0) if RSI < 30 else 0

Description: Stocks with overly bullish sentiment scores are likely to experience a price correction.
Expression: signal = (Sentiment Score - 3-month avg Sentiment Score) / 3-month avg Sentiment Score if signal > 0.2

Description: A price bounce off a previously established support level suggests a reversion upwards.
Expression: signal = 1 if Price > SupportLevel and Price was previously below SupportLevel else 0

Description: Large absolute log returns from prior periods suggest the likelihood of a mean reversion in the price.
Stocks with RSI values significantly above 70 or below 30 will revert to the mean.
Expression: if (RSI > 70) then sell; if (RSI < 30) then buy

Description: Assets with higher 10-day volume-weighted average price returns will continue to outperform.
Expression: Signal = SUM(Price[t-i] * Volume[t-i] for i in 0..9) / SUM(Volume[t-i] for i in 0..9) - Price[t-10] / Price[t-10]

Description: Assets with a significant increase in volume compared to the previous day will outperform in the next 2 days.
Assets that have recently underperformed will see short-term positive returns.
Assets with a significant increase in trading volume coupled with positive price movement will outperform.
Mean reversion strength is amplified when negative sentiment coincides with price deviations from the average.
Expression: signal = (Close - MA20) / ATR20 * SentimentScore; if (signal < -threshold) then buy

Description: Combining signals from RSI, Bollinger Bands, and MACD increases the accuracy of mean reversion prediction.
Expression: signal = RSI + (Close - MA20) / StdDev20 + MACD; if (signal > threshold) then sell; if (signal < -threshold) then buy

Description: Assets that have experienced a sharp drop in price over 3 days may show a short-term bounce.
Assets whose 7-day momentum is greater than their 14-day momentum are expected to continue outperforming.
